loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 31 year old woman who adds additional income to support her family.  She is married to Nicholus and they are blessed with two children.  Anastasia has been operating a retail shop for a period of two years earning herself an income of KES. 6,000 at the end of every month.

Anastasia was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES.10,000.  She intends to use this amount to buy sugar, rice, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Anastasia plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, detergents, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a smallholder farmer who lives in Kapsumai in the North Rift region of Kenya. She relies on maize farming and dairy sales to look after her family of four children. After three years in farming, she has developed a deep, passionate interest in dairy farming. She named her cow Chelege (local vernacular for blemish).

Rose is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. The new cow will double the volume of milk production on the farm. This will elevate Rose's livelihood and the quality of life led by her children. 

She stated that the increased income will go to loan repayment and her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kulusumu

texts.en: Kulusumu is married.  She has six children and three go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.   She sells on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and also to expand her sales in the charcoal business. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Indian Creek, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He is motivated to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial, long-term investment for his family. Martin believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop that is both good for the environment, and will help develop his local community. He wants to secure a Kiva microloan, so that he can expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and to improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise, and to sell some of them in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en: Mauricia is married with four children and three go to school. She has additional family members. She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes, bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes.    She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of buying land to start farming. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, green bananas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Hello lenders!  Meet Peter, a humble and hardworking farmer with the drive and determination that distinguishes the men and women of Kitale area of Kenya. Kitale is an area that is blessed with favorable weather patterns and is always referred to as the “food basket “area of Kenya. Peter is very hard working and has been doing farming for the past twelve years.  Through the fruits of his hard work he has been able to take care of his family needs. Through practicing mixed farming, that is dairy farming and crop farming, Peter has been able to always get good returns from these two ventures and he has always managed to put food on the table for his family. Peter is very enterprising, and he wants to start poultry farming so that he can supplement his income and assure his family a bright future. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy poultry. Through the income that he will generate from poultry farming, he will be able to comfortably assure his child of uninterrupted learning, because he will be able to pay tuition fees and provide all other basic needs that his family may require. Peter is a strong believer that education is the key to success, and that’s why he will do anything positively good to assure his child of a good future. Peter projects that through increased profits from egg selling and poultry selling, he will have a great impact on the society and his family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Danaya est constitué de cinq femmes  tous mariées et vivant majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 55 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente d’habits (pagnes wax) et des poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Maman  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite) à une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) à Kalaban-coro. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 90 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coro au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maman  compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Danaya Group is made up of five married women. Most of them live in polygamous households. They average 55 years of age and 7 children each. They all live in Kalaban-Coro, a neighborhood in Bamako.

They got to know each other through their money-earning businesses, and tontines in the neighborhood. The members of the group are merchants, and sell fish and clothing, such as "pagnes wax" (colorful African cloth). 

In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan).

Ms. Maman (second woman standing from the left in the photograph) is well renowned as a clothing (pagnes wax) reseller in Kalaban-Coro. She intends to use this loan to buy 90 lengths of pagnes wax.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and resells in Kalaban-Coro, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, Ms. Maman intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 200'000. Part of it will be used to provide for her children's daily needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in her business. 

She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to reach her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy 90 lengths of "pagnes wax" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Kenny

texts.en: Kenny is a new cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Indian Creek, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He got motivated to join the cacao industry because he sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for his family. Kenny believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop, one that is both good for the environment and will help develop his local community. He wants to secure a Kiva microloan so that he can expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase cacao seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cacao seedlings

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old and married, with six children. With three children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods and beverages.

Elizabeth has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Sarah lives in her own house. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utilities and feeding the family. 

Sarah has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 13 years and she works 6 days a week. Sarah sells her products from home by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and houses for rent. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and high transportation costs. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations is to build rental houses.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, cakes, beverages, biscuits, fruits, soap, perfume, deodorant, and balsam

loans.name: Silvia Marleny

texts.es: Silvia de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su  hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Sivia, 42, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughter, who works and helps her out financially.

She has been making a living selling personal use products for a number of years now. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and the like—everything in bulk quantities. With this investment, she will be able to continue with her business in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and the like—everything in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is single and have three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes at the market on retail basis and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.    

Patience sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to educate her children to university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. 

Patience lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rasmiyeh

texts.en:
Rasmiyeh is a 44-year-old Lebanese divorced woman and living with her two children who are attending school. Despite her social state, Rasmiyeh works unbreakably to continue supporting her children no matter what it takes.  She specializes in producing homemade food for the past 10 years and she really likes her occupation. Her goods are highly recommended to get bought as they are very tasty and full of flavor. 

Today, with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Rasmiyeh will purchase tools and supplies needed for food production and keeping. Rasmiyeh states that she is very excited to receive the loan as she is certain that it will impact positively on her business.

loans.use: buy food production supplies

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en:
Saudah is married with four children, three of them go to school.  She has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years.  She sells seven days a week.

Saudah has applied for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, green bananas, and sweet potatoes.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires of owning a residential house.  

Saudah decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the timely loans. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes offers home manicure, pedicure and other services to people who live in her area. She has been doing this for 25 years and has been able to sustain her family needs and send her children to primary and secondary school. Mercedes has been blessed with five children, three of whom are now married while the other two are working. During her days off, she sells cakes and noodles to earn additional income. In order to continue expanding her business, she is seeking for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy supplies. Mercedes is very grateful for the help she receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman who has two kids and lives with her husband, an aluminum worker. Two years ago she came to a decision to start her own business to augment the family’s income. Thus, she began to produce homemade food and traditional provisions. 

The Lebanese community adores eating traditional food, especially the ones that are prepared at home.  And today, with the intention of enhancing her business, Saada wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase seeds and materials such as jars etc.  Saada is confident that the loan will help her improve her work as well as her financials.

loans.use: buy food preparation materials

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders!  Meet Patrick, a 37-year-old man who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. Patrick is a father of two lovely children that he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed on hungry stomachs. Patrick hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya.  Patrick never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life.   

Patrick started farming and has been doing farming for the past 17 years. Through those years he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Patrick practices mixed farming on his farm and through the profits he has managed to take care of his family's needs and also give his children a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success.”  

Patrick is a man who is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Patrick wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.  

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Patrick to take their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Patrick hopes that through the loan he will improve his living conditions. Patrick dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. 

Patrick is not a selfish man and also wants to impact society, that is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: start a horticulture business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a charming mother of 7 children who practises mixed-farming in the Kaptumo area of Kenya. She has been doing farming since 1980 on her husband's 5-acre piece of land. She ascribes most of her success to her husband's support and encouragement. She has been married to him for 40 years! 

On the farm, Esther grows cabbage, bananas and trees. She has more than 2000 trees! She also keeps poultry for egg production.
  
Esther is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry and rabbits. Rabbit farming is on the steady rise in Kenya because of an opening market for rabbit products. This investment is very close to her heart as it increases her income and diversifies her product portfolio thus spreading risks.  She has pre-committed the income generated from this investment to pay for her child's university fees. She sees a bright future in her children and she is ready to support them all she can.

loans.use: buy poultry and rabbits

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, 25, is a smallholder farmer based in the Kaptumo area in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She started farming in 2000 on a 5-acre piece of land. Today, the farm has grown and 2 permanent employees help her run the business. She grows bananas and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. 

Flora is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and construct a poultry shed. She will use any remaining amount to purchase green tea. She currently has 3 cows on the farm and 4 chickens. This investment will enable her to purchase more poultry and improve the birds' welfare by constructing a shelter for them. 

She will use the returns from the investment to grow the business and take care of her 2 children. Her goal in life is to continually work hard and pull her family out of poverty.

loans.use: buy poultry and build a shed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a mother of 4 who runs a small mixed-farm based in the  Moiben area of Kenya. She started the business 6 years ago. Today, the farm has undergone tremendous growth and diversification. 

Gladys' primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and a job salary.  Gladys is looking to introduce sheep farming. She is seeking a loan to purchase sheep. To her, farming is a continuous learning process. By venturing into sheep farming, she puts herself in a position to learn more about this type of farming. If it turns out to be profitable, she will scale it and specialize in it.  The income from this investment is pre-committed to her children's education and food security in her home.

loans.use: buy a sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals and niébé peas

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.en:
When Mirtha came from the Dominican Republic 18 years ago, she made sure to bring her love of cooking her native food. Now, she is the owner of Mirtha Food for Parties, a home-based Bronx, NY business. She specializes in food for special events like birthdays and baby showers – highly personal affairs for her clients’ friends and families. Mirtha enjoys meeting new people and making them happy on their special day. 

Mirtha needs a loan to purchase a new refrigerator, hire an assistant, and use marketing to expand her business. Her dream is to one day open her own restaurant in the Bronx and continue to cook authentic DR food!

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, hire an assistant, and use marketing to expand her business.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 54 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Bernardita is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernardita has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo logro estudiar hasta un 6º grado, por la situación económica ya no pudo seguir estudiando, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y en la albañilería, sus hijos ya todos están fuera del hogar ya formaron su propia familia.
María toda su vida sea dedicado a trabajar en diferentes labores, pero hace como 9 años le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar costura en una academia y con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo logro terminar este estudio, gracias a ello a logrado conseguir una buena cantidad de clientes quienes le dan mucho trabajo en temporadas tiene que trabajar todo el día, si es posible hasta altas horas de la noche ya que tiene mucho trabajo.
En ocasiones le ayudan un familiar o su hijo menor quien le apoya en esta actividad cuando está bastante atareada.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una máquina de coser para hacer costura fina.
Espera para un futuro lograr una mejor oportunidad ampliando su negocio a través de mejores máquinas y tener más clientes y ayudar a su familia con los gastos
texts.en:
María is 51 years old. With much effort and work she managed to study until Grade 6 but due to her financial situation could not continue to study.. Her husband works as a farmer and as a bricklayer. Her children have all left the home and have their own families.

María has been working all her life at different jobs. Nine years ago she was given the opportunity to study sewing in an academy and with the help of her children and her husband she managed to finish her studies. Thanks to this she has managed to amass a good quantity of clients. At times they give her a lot of work and she has to work all day. And if possible until the late hours of the night, as she has so much work. Sometimes a family member or her youngest son helps her when she has a lot of work.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a sewing machine to do fine sewing work. She hopes in the future to have greater opportunities by expanding her business with better machines. She will have more clients and can help her family with the expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make fine clothing.

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en: Sinak is 22 years old and is a second-year student at university. His major is Banking and Finance. He lives with his parents in Kratie province in Cambodia. Because of a shortage of finances, he would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees. With this loan, he will be able to graduate successfully. After graduation, Sinak is going to find a good job.

loans.use: pay his university fees

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years of age, married and blessed with seven children.  She has a home service business.  Josefina is also engaged in a hog raising and farming business as an additional source of income.  She is thankful because her children are supportive in running their hog raising and farming business.  Now, she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 3000, which will be used to buy a variety nail polish for her manicure and pedicure business.  She hopes that through this amount of loan, she could further improve her way of living and get ahead in life.  

In the photo, Josefina wears brown blouse while her customer is in the white shirt.

loans.use: buy nail polish

loans.name: Geanna

texts.en: Geanna is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who uses her income to pay household expenses, including the cost of sending three of her children to school. Geanna earns a living by fishing in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional supplies for her business. She has been in her current line of work for three years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is married and works hard to support her family.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

Adelina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with seven children. She is 41 years old and three of her children are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Annabelle requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials to use like fish nets, etc.  In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing materials

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 42 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 17 years.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 53 years old and one of her children is school.

Gloria has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  

Gloria requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish.   In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 34 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Chona works very hard to provide for her family.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.  

Chona has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.   In the future, Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with three children. With one child still in school, Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, coffee, juice, canned goods, etc.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Anita has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es soltero y n o tiene hijos, vive con sus dos hermanos y sus padres y nadie depende de él.

José trabaja como docente en un instituto educativo nacional, tiene 6 años ejerciendo esta profesión, su horario de trabajo por lo general es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm, para llegar camina cerca de 15 minutos. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca productora de leche, siempre tuvo en mente comprar una para  producir la leche que su familia va a beber.

José sueña con casarse y formar una familia, no sin antes apoyar a su pareja para que termine sus estudios y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: José is 32 years old, is single and has no children. He lives with two siblings and his father. He has no one dependent on him. José works as a teacher in a National Educational Institute. He has been in this profession for 6 years. His work schedule is from 7 am until 4 pm. It takes him 15 minutes to walk to work. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow. He has always had it in his mind to produce milk for his family to drink. José dreams of getting married and forming a family but not until his partner can complete her studies and he finishes building their house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Carminda

texts.en:
Carminda lives in Dili.  She is married and is a business woman. She has been doing business since 2006, and started with her own working capital of $500.   

Carminda is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store to sell, including:  sugar, coffee, books, soaps, toothpaste, cooking oils, comb, tea, candles, shampoo and other things. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is married and has 2 children. She has a very high interest in doing business.  She has been involved in business activities since 2013.  She began with her own working capital of $400 and she makes her best of it. 

Celestina is earning good money so she is taking this loan to improve the management of her business.   She requested a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store, including lactogen milk, milk SGM, medicine, books, detergent, ketchup, salt, balm, lighters, cigarettes, shampoo and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase condiments for resale

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marife is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marife has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a 11,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Marife has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fish to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Looking back on his childhood, Emmanuel wishes he had an organized youth sports training program. “Not only to help me athletically, but to help boost my confidence!” he says. Now, after working in the health and fitness industry for over 20 years, he has decided to provide this opportunity to his community, through his business: XPC Training Systems. XPC is part of a franchise and offers youth and adult training around Brevard County, FL and surrounding area.

Emmanuel knows there is a demand for his service. XPC recently moved just across the street – but now is next to a major nationwide gym chain. He says, “In our new location, we have access to over 6000 members who will use our services for themselves and their children. Our foot traffic has increased over 500% since our relocation!” This surge in clients is great – but Emmanuel needs to make sure XPC has enough gym equipment to handle these new customers! Emmanuel needs to purchase sleds, kettle bells, training ropes, and medicine balls. He will also use this loan towards marketing.
 
Emmanuel is very positive about the future.  “I will grow the business and expand to 2-4 more locations throughout Central Florida in the next 2-5 years.”
Check out his business: http://parisixpc.com/

loans.use: to purchase fitness equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create a website and develop a marketing strategy.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Bella is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Bella has been raising livestock for 15 years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Ann, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Mosombor, in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with four children. 

For the last ten years, Ann has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. She really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Ann finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture, but she constantly faces a challenge of poor productivity on her farm because of a lack of farm inputs. 

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Ann will purchase quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production level and this will immediately translate to increased income levels. 

Ann is a very hard-working woman and she believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. The extra income she will get will be used to repay the loan and increase her farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Dúo Angelica De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Angelica de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Angélica quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como cremas, talcos, colonias, champo, lociones, perfumes, para damas, caballeros y niños desde hace dos años.  Siendo vendedora  ambulante de su colonia,  su sueño es tener un local para no caminar tanto y también tener una librería algún día.  Hay varios pedidos de cosméticos que le han hecho pero aun necesita pedir más y debe ir a  la tienda para comprar lo que le hace falta, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita otro préstamo.  Su compañera la señora María Gregoria de 34 años de edad.
texts.en:
Dúo Angelica de San Pedro

Angélica is the manager of this group.  She sells cosmetics like creams, talcum powders, colognes, shampoo, lotions, and perfume for women, men and children.  She has been doing this for two years.  As she is an itinerant saleswoman in her neighborhood, her dream is to have a place so that she does not have to walk so much.  She also dreams of having a bookstore someday.

She has received various cosmetic orders, but she still needs more.  She needs to go to the store to buy what she does not have.  However, she does not have enough money.  That is why she needs another loan.  

Her colleague, María Gregoria, is 34 years old.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marita is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 2,900 loan through NWTF to purchase solar lamp.

Marita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan de 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, estudio hasta  9° grado de educación básica, su esposa es empleada de una empresa que procesa pescado. Solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Juan es empleado, tiene 11 años trabajando en una empresa que da mantenimiento a piscinas privadas, limpiando analizando Ph, niveles de cloro y demás, viaja cerca de 30 minutos en bicicleta para llegar a las oficinas de su trabajo.

 Juan utilizará el préstamo para comprar arena y cemento para aplicar una capa de mezcla a su casa que está construida con adobe, así hacerla más resistente. Jun sueña con tener una casa propia y tener algo para heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 33, is married and has two children.  He went to school through the ninth grade.  His wife is employed by a company that processes fish.  Only his wife and their children live with him.

Juan has been working for 11 years for a company that provides maintenance to private swimming pools.  He cleans and analyzes pH and chlorine levels, among others.  He travels close to 30 minutes by bicycle to get to his work offices.

Juan will use the loan to buy sand and cement to apply a layer of mix to his house, which is made of adobe.  This way it will be stronger.  Juan dreams of having his own house and having something for his children to inherit.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement.

Florencia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and has supported her children's education. She has taken a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer to restore her farm's nutrients. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home for a safe living space for the family.

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en:
Mackline is married with three children, and all go to school. She has additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Mackline's monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for eight years. She sells seven days a week, and her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and bunches of green bananas. 

Mackline aspires to own a residential house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Susana

She will use the loan to purchase more materials to expand her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

She would like a loan to pay her school fee. She hopes that after she graduates from university, she will become a professional nurse at the national clinic.

loans.use: To pay her school fees.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Embekoun Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe EMBEKOUN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe EMBEKOUN sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du poisson fumé, du sel, des paniers de tomate et de la chou fleur sur place chez les grossistes.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Embekoun group is made up of married women who on average are 37 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in Dioila, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
They met through family contacts, through living in the same neighbourhood, and through friendship. They work in catering, the sale of condiments, and the clothing trade. 
This is the fourth solidarity loan for the women of the Embekoun group. In an effort to satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they have asked for help from Soro Yiriwaso.
The client named Fatoumata, the first person on the left in the row of people sitting down, is illiterate. At present, she sells condiments. She plans to buy onions, smoked fish, salt, baskets of tomatoes and cauliflower from the wholesalers.
The sales are made retail for cash to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 15 000Fcfa that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

Renaida hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.name: Monica

Monica is a 42-year-old married mother of eight. With six children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 47, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income planting and selling cactus. 

She started this business nine years ago and is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of cactus to meet her customers' demands.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of cactus for planting and selling.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long is 56 years old, married and the father of four sons. He and his wife live with their family in Ho Chi Minh City, and he supports them by planting and selling Water Morning Glories. Long intends to use this loan to rent a plot of land on which he can raise more plants to sell to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and help him improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to plant and sell Water Morning Glories.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 55 years old and widowed. She has two daughters and lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuong started her business selling beverages seven years ago. Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different kinds of beverages to meet her customers' needs. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy beverages for resale from her store.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is now requesting a new loan to buy detergent, shampoo, sanitation items and other household goods to restock her general store. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.

Sang hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding both the size of her store and her sales and lead to improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy detergent, shampoo and sanitation items to restock her store.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 53 years old and married, with two children.

Melchora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like biscuits, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks.

Melchora has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from charcoal-vending.

Melchora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like biscuits, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu is 44 years old and married with a son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by selling rice at their house. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of rice to sell from her store. 

Lieu hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of rice to sell from her store.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh would like to take a further loan to buy more products such as candies, fast food, noodles and household items to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

Linh hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy household items, noodles, fast food and candies for selling at her store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 52-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has been selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Remedios has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take another loan to buy household electrical products and appliances. Phuong's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase household electrical products and appliances.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley, is 31 years old, married, has three children and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well. She   earns a good income for the family. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for fertilization of her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and support her children's education. She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home to have safe living for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more items like slippers, pants, plasticware and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, pants, plasticware and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Elvia Santos

texts.es:
Elvia de 35 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijas,  de 17 años de edad , dejo la escuela en 7° grado y ayuda a los oficios del hogar, de 16 años de edad que estudia 5° grado de educación básica y de 11 años de edad que estudia 3° grado de educación básica. Elvia solo pudo estudiar hasta 1° grado de educación básica. Su pareja presta servicios de seguridad privada en la capital, solo él y sus hijas viven con ella.

Elvia es ama de casa y su única preocupación es velar por que a sus hijas no les falte nada, el préstamo lo necesita para comprar 16 pliegos de lámina y 4 libras de clavos para construir un pequeño cuarto para la cocina y sacarla del interior de la casa, ya que ahúma la madera, el techo y además se lo recomendaron por ser malo para la salud.

Elvia sueña con mejorar el piso de su casa y reparar el techo donde tiene la pila con agua.
texts.en:
Elvia, 35, is in a relationship and has three daughters: a 17-year-old, who dropped out of school in seventh grade and helps her out with the household chores; a 16-year-old, who is in fifth grade; and an 11-year-old, who is in third grade. Elvia was able to study only up to first grade. Her partner makes a living offering private security services in the capital. Only he and her daughters live with her.

Elvia is a homemaker, and her only concern is to ensure that her daughters have everything they need. 

Because her stove smokes the wooden walls and the roof, which is bad for their health, she was recommended to relocate the stove outside her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy 16 sheets of metal and 4 pounds of nails to build a small room outside her house for the stove.

Elvia dreams about improving the floor in her house and fixing the roof, where she has a water tank.

loans.use: to buy 16 metal sheets and 4 pounds of nails to build a small room to house the stove.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Asuncion is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.

Asuncion has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Asuncion has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
A married parent of four children, Juliet works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from a coffee shop. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Juliet is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more household goods like soap, milk, spices, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell, like soap, milk, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a 50-year-old married mother of eight children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Charito has been operating a general store in the Philippines for three years now; she has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Charito would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 44 years old and has seven children. She is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is fifty years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years she has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by selling vegetables.

Nanette is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her sugarcane fields.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lorena aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora, 77,is a widow with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nicanora is borrowing 29000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

Nicanora has been raising pigs for 25 years, and she earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and married with two children. Rosalie works very hard to provide for her family. 

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc, (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell through her general store business.

NWTF is re-listing Noeme's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda, 48, is a hardworking married woman with ten children, four of whom are in school. For the past two years she has worked selling vegetables from her stall in the Philippines.

Criselda has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell. She is working towards saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years, and she earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000  through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her general store business, like soft drinks, noodles, shampoo, etc. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, noodles, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 56 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Rafaela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Rafaela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 35, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by repairing and selling old cellphones. She earns an income running a food stall selling meals for her customers in the local are. 

Thao started this business eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of raw food and ingredients to make better meals for her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw food and ingredients to make meals for selling from her food stall.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 56 years old and married. She has two sons and three daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband are running a business making and selling cakes. They started this business four years ago.

She intends to use her loan to buy flour, sugar and food coloring to make cakes.

Tam hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and food coloring to make cakes for selling.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, solo dos viven con ella. Estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, su esposo es mecánico y tiene su propio taller, solo él y sus dos hijos viven con él. 

María es ama de casa, pero ayuda a su esposo con la administración del taller que tienen desde hace 15 años, se encarga de la comprar de ciertos productos, con ellos trabajan un hijo y 3 empleados más.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar aceites que necesitan en el taller, ya que por el  momento están reparando maquinaria pesada y no cuentan con lo necesario para hacerlo. María sueña con sacar adelanta a su hija menor, así como hizo con los otros y seguir trabajando con el taller para mantener a la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, is married and has 5 children, only two of whom are living with her. She was educated to the level of 5th grade primary school.  Her husband is a mechanic and has his own  repair shop: only he and their two children live with her.

Maria is a housewife, but has helped her husband with the administration of the workshop for 15 years. She is responsible for the purchase of certain products.  One son and 3 other employees work with them.

The loan will be used to buy various oils they need in the workshop, because at the moment they are repairing heavy machinery and do not have the necessary supplies to do so. Maria dreams of helping her youngest daughter get ahead, as she did with the others, and of continuing to work with the repair shop to support the family.

loans.use: to buy various oils they need in the workshop.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn has two children. The youngest is still in school, which increases the costs for his family. He is a strong father: he works as a farmer and at the same time provides services in his internet cafe to provide for his family. He successfully repaid a previous loan he put toward raising pigs.

Glenn is applying for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy an additional computer for his cafe. He wants to expand his business so as to better his family’s prospects for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer for his cafe.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.en:
This saleswoman's name is Safarmo. She is 56 years old. Safarmo lives in the capital of Tajikistan, a city called Dushanbe, with her husband and daughter. Her husband is a migrant laborer, and he goes to Russia to work seasonally. Her daughter is a saleswoman, too. 

Safarmo began her small trading business two and a half years ago. She sells fruits and vegetables in her retail outlet at the market. Despite the cold and hot weather Safarmo goes to the market to sell her goods every day. 

Currently, Safarmo needs to increase the assortment of her goods to attract more customers and increase sales. For this purpose, she asks for a loan. Safarmo relies on your help.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is 48 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school and Alda works very hard to provide for them.

Alda's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Alda has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Alda is committed to rebuild, and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs and groceries

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business, in the Philippines.

Casiana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Casiana would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Priscilla Jane

texts.en:
Priscilla Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Priscilla Jane has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Priscilla Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is 32 years old and married with two children. Rowela works very hard to provide for them.

Rowela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Rowela has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Rowela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben works hard to support his family. Ruben is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

He requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Ruben has been in this business for 20 years now.

He would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ronita is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 13 years. 

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ronita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Sarah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Gerald, married, and a father of three. 

His economic activity is rabbit-keeping. Gerald joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more skills in enterprise development and financial management. This has equipped him with skills which have helped him improve the management of his business. 

Gerald needs a loan to construct a modern hatch and to buy quality feed for his rabbits. He believes this will greatly help increase his income to, therefore, be in a position to provide basic necessities to his family, such as food and clothing.
 
Gerald is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy rabbit feed and to pay for construction of a modern hatch.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 50 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from landscaping. Huong runs a business of raising ducklings. She started this business 15 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong intends to take a loan to increase her working capital for buying animal feed and ducklings for raising and selling. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and ducklings for raising and selling.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 32 years old and married with a son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a worker in a local factory. Khanh runs a shop, selling iron doors to earn a living. 

She started her business four years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more iron doors to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy iron doors to sell at her store.

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyet, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local company. She earns an income running a general store in the front of her house. 

Tuyet is the group leader of a three-member loan group that resides in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is in the middle of the group. Both of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Tuyet is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. 

Tuyet hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family. She also hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.pt:
A senhora  Isaura  48 anos é comerciante, casada mae de 5 filhos todos ja maiores de idade apenas 1 estuda vive na casa dos servicos de seu esposo.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar feijao, frango em pedacos, moelas, frangos, acucar para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro e conta com ajuda de seu esposo que e militar, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Isaura is a 48-year-old businesswoman. She is a married mother to 5 children, all of whom are now grown up except for one who is currently studying. She lives in the house her husband is building for them. She plans to use this loan to buy beans, chicken pieces, gizzards, whole chickens and sugar to restock her business. Her future projects and dreams include growing her business, responding to her clients' needs and finishing the building work on her house. She says that the greatest challenges she has faced are in relation to finances so she saves her money in a xitique initiative as well as receiving support from her husband, who is in the military. She plans to apply for further loans in order to fulfil her plan.

loans.use: To buy beans, chicken pieces, gizzards, whole chickens and sugar.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline, 46 years old, is married with 2 children and has been selling fish in their village while her husband does the fishing to make a living. She borrowed a loan to buy new fishing nets to improve their fishing activity. She is hopeful of making more income for the education costs of her children.

loans.use: to improve their fishing activity.

loans.name: Gituamba Abc Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hanna. Hanna is 42 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which has helped her realize her strength in business. She has engaged herself in the full-time business of vegetable farming, dairy farming, and poultry farming. 

Hanna wants a loan to boost her vegetable farming business by buying manure and fertilizer. She believes this will improve her crop yield and increase her profits, which in turn will help her to support her children's education and provide better clothing for them.

Hanna is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 34, is married and has two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker in an industrial zone. He earns an income running a general store in front of his house. 

He started this business seven years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as food and beverages for selling from his general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 53, is widowed and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a shop selling beverages in front of her house. 

She started this business two years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying soft drinks, yogurt and other fruit juices for selling and better satisfying her customers.

Hoa hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, fruit juice and yogurt for selling from her shop.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 37 years old and is married with three children. She and her husband have been running a shop selling curtains and bedding for 12 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hue is requesting a loan to buy fabric and sewing materials to make and sell more curtains and bedding. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials to make and sell curtains and bedding.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
This is Hellen, 54 years old, married and blessed with five children. She grows maize and vegetables on her small farm. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July, 2013 and is grateful for its enterprise training which has enabled her to manage her farm more effectively.

Hellen is borrowing 10,000 KES through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and manure to help increase her yields. With a higher income she will be able to provide her family with basic needs such as education for her children, medical care and clothing.

Hellen is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for their financial support and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizer and manure for her maize and vegetables.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret, 36 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013. 

Margaret does maize and beans farming. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise more effectively, unlike before. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. This will increase her farm production, meet the demand for cereals, and earn her more income, hence, supporting her children’s education and family's basic needs. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Connie is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

Connie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is in agriculture and she is selling vegetables. She started selling vegetables in 2006 with her own working capital of $200.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. 

Every day her life is selling vegetables because she is earning a good income from it. Many people come to buy her vegetables because she is selling in the center of the market. 

Domingas is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business. She will buy more vegetables, including onions, garlic, carrots, beans and other things to sell. There are seven members in the family: herself, her husband and their 5 children.

loans.use: To buy onions, garlic, carrots, beans and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joan

texts.en:
Mary Joan is 44 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Joan has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 51 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Cristita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Cristita has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods. 

Cristita is committed to rebuild and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and eggs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, thirty years old, married and blessed with three children. For the past two years she has earned a living raising chickens.

Susan joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August, 2013 and is grateful for the training she received regarding creating a business and using her savings well, skills that have helped her manage her chicken business more effectively.
