Susan is borrowing 10,000 KES to buy chicken feed and repair her chicken coop. These improvements will result in more income, thus enabling her to more easily pay her children's school fees and provide other basic needs such as food for her young family.

Susan is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and repair her chicken coop.

loans.name: Ongemuiten Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jescar, twenty-four years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. 

Jescar does maize and beans farming and also sells cereals. She gained business knowledge through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on Enterprise creation and development. She is now able to run her business well and profitably. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds for higher farm yields. This will improve her income so she will be in a position to pay school fees for her children as well as continuing to support her family's needs.

Jescar is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 36 years old, a married woman and responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shakeela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shakeela also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shakeela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en: Joaninha is requesting a loan of $1500 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business. She lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she still happy to do her business. Joaninha has been involved in business activities since 2008, when she started with her own working capital of $800. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said with this loan she will be able to improve her management for her business and to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her business

loans.name: Calina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 26 anos de idade, casada oficialmente mãe de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo.
Trabalha na Saúde como Enfermeira Geral a mais de 5 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende iniciar uma obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia, cimento, blocos, varões e outros que forem necessário. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e dar continuidade com os  estudos até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é ter uma casa condigna.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo, the borrower is 26 years old. She is a married mother to one little one and she is responsible for supporting her mother, who also lives in Maputo. She has worked as a General Nurse in the Health Services for more than 5 years, and she spends her income on her home expenses. She wants to start building a house and she will use this loan to buy sand, cement, blocks, rods and other necessary items. This will be her second loan from Hluvuku.
In the future, she wants to finish building her house and to attain her higher level education. Her greatest challenge has been in relation to having a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement, blocks, rods and other items.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 28 years old; he has been farming for 3 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 33 years old and has five children; three children are in school.

Delia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for her motorcycle transport.

Delia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie works hard to support her family. Gerlie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gerlie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gerlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 32 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children who are in school. Her husband has run a clothing sales business for 3 years. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for resale, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Rubina is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to  buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce and paint the walls of his home.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inharime Província de Inhambane tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 3 filhos  que  frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu pai que se encontra em Maputo enviando lhe mensalmente um valor de 1.000mt. 
É negociante conta própria, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo amendoim e feijão. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e fazer dependências para aluguer. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Born in Inharime province in Inhambane, the borrower is a 42-year-old married mother to 3 children, all of whom are at school. She is also financially responsible for her father, who lives in Maputo, sending him a monthly amount of 1,000 meticals each month.
She runs her own business and she spends her income on her home expenses. She intends to use this loan to buy nuts and beans in order to expand her business operations. This will be her second loan from Hluvuku.
In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to build some outbuildings to rent out. The greatest challenge that she faces is in relation to ensuring that her children attain their higher level studies.

loans.use: to buy nuts and beans

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 39-years-old and married with six children. With five children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

Elma has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrella is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Estrella has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 27 years. She earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged 50 years; he is married with 4 children aged between 5 and 15, and all of them go to school. He has been farming for 5 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cattle for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children. The additional person in the picture is a cattle herder.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Matucella

texts.en:
Matucella is 68 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 16 and 33; six of them go school. He has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for farming. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad has been operating  her fruit stand for over four years and has been able to sustain the business. With her profits, she has supported her family and funded some home improvements for a comfortable living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying a variety of fruits to resell. She is now aiming to increase sales and with this in mind, she took a new loan to purchase a larger volume of fruit in addition to her current inventory. She is hoping to cater to the needs of her costumers and increase her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase a larger volume of fruit

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma  is 51-years-old and all of her children are in school.

Emma has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Emma  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 5 children. 

Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shabana provides sewing services and earns additional income beyond her husband's in order to contribute to managing the household.
 
She is in need of different kinds of goods, such as needles, thread, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items needed for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 42-years-old and has four children.  Lani is married and her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lani requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lani has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lani would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mmasi

texts.en:
Mmasi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Njokerio United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Paul, a member of Njokerio United Self Help Group. He is thirty years old, married and blessed with one child.

He is a maize farmer. Part of the produce is used for family consumption and the rest is for commercial purposes. Having undertaken the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training in enterprise development and financial management, he has been able to run the enterprise more efficiently.

He has applied for a loan to boost his farming business by buying fertilizer and manure. This will improve the crop yield, thus generating more income. Paul will be in a position to provide basic necessities for his family, such as food and clothes.

Paul is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support, and he promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Bujamal

texts.ru: Бужамал успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бужамал есть 5 коров, 30 овец и 1,0 Га земельной доли, где Бужамал выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Бужамал хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и кормов. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность платить за обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Bujamal successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Today, Bujamal's business contains 5 cows, 30 sheep and 1.0 hectare of land, where she grows clover for the household consumption. Bujamal wants to continue growing her business further, and this is why she once again requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock and livestock feed. She will invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business in order to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed in order to be more profitable and save money for her children's education

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es: El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales para la elaboración de su producto, hilo nylon, pintura y alambre, manifiesta que por acercarse la época de fin de año quiere tener variedad que ofrecer. María sueña con mejorar su negocio, impartir clases a jóvenes para la elaboración de artesanías y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en: The loan will be used to purchase materials to make her product: nylon thread, paint and wire. She says that as the year is drawing to a close she wants to have a greater variety to offer. Maria dreams of improving her business, giving youngsters classes on how to make crafts and improving her house little by little.

loans.use: to purchase nylon thread, paint and wire

loans.name: Manzana 2 Group

texts.en:
María
She was fifteen years old when her father died from a disease. They were three siblings two girls and a boy. María had the goal of studying, but her mother stay alone and could not support her in her studies. Instead María had to carry firewood and work the land.
María has had three loans, in her first year she used her loan to buy medicine and initiate a small pharmacy, with her second loan she expanded the small pharmacy of her town, and with her third loan she began a small stationer´s shop. Now she has two small businesses and is aware of the benefits she has achieved for her family.
Now she will use her loan to expand her pharmacy and school supply store.
María is the leader of the Manzana 2 Group, the group consists of eleven women, and they will invest their loans in  agricultural and retail activities. On average they have three children. The average of their loans is Q 3,627.

loans.use: To expand her pharmacy and school supply store

loans.name: Manzana 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita
She is one of six siblings, four of them died, one of her sisters died in the Guatemalan armed conflict, three died of different diseases. She was fourteen when her father died. Her mother remarried, when her mother died Margarita lived with her stepfather, he took her to the village where he was born. She studied only to first grade in the elementary school.
Three years ago, she started her relationship with Asociación Chajulense de Mujeres Unidas por la Vida, Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. With her first loan she began buying and selling chicken meat, she saved part of her earnings. With her second loan, and her savings, she bought two ropes of land. With her third loan she bought and planted cardamom seeds. This year she is harvesting cardamom. She thinks that with the support of the Association, she is contributing to a better life for her family.
This year she will use her loan to expand her cardamom and chicken meat businesses.
Margarita is the leader of the Manzana 1 Group, the group is integrated by ten women that will invest her loans in Agricultural and Retail activities. On average they have five children. The average of their loans is Q 3,680.

loans.use: To expand her cardamom and chicken meat businesses

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married, with six children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Жылдызкан по-прежнему входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое, Жылдызкан является лидером группы. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок и 18 коз. На участке 0,7 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Жылдызкан вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan successfully repaid her loan after using it as intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her get this financing.  She is still a member of the "Almaluu" group, which comprises two additional members.  Jyldyzkan is the leader of this three-person group.  She currently owns two cows, one calf and 18 goats.  In addition, she grows corn on 0.7 hectare of land.  Once again she is turning to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 95,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn has been operating her retail store for over four years and has been able to sustain the business. She has supported her family, and bought some home improvements for a comfortable living. She has repaid successfully her previous loan, which she used for the business.

Now she is aiming for an increase of sales, and with this aim, she took a new loan. She will use the loan to buy more volume of timber logs to sell, adding to her inventory capital. She hopes to cater for the needs of her customers, and increase her income, as well.

loans.use: to buy more volume of timber logs to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old, a married woman, and has three children. All of her children are in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Liza has been in agriculture for 10 years, now. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
Maria Carmen, 59 years old, has one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria Carmen has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Maria Carmen requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy processed food to sell.

Maria Carmen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maria Carmen would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy processed food to sell

loans.name: Mercedez Gricelda

texts.es:
Mercedes de 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella es egresada de técnico en enfermería, su pareja está en el extranjero y le poya económicamente. Con ella vive su madre y su hijo y solo él depende de ella.

 Mercedes no tiene ninguna actividad económica, solo ayuda  su madre en los oficios del hogar, depende del apoyo de su pareja, antes trabajaba como empleada doméstica en l ciudad, pero desde que se acompañó regresó a su pueblo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un terreno que le servirá para alojar a sus animales y también para alquilarlo a los agricultores. Mercedes sueña con terminar sus estudios y obtener su título para poder trabajar, quiere construir su propia casa y dar el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 24 years old, is unmarried and has a son who studies in the community school. She is studying to be a nurse technician. Her partner is abroad and helps her financially. Her mother lives with her and her son and he is dependent on her.

Mercedes does not have a job; rather she helps her mother with household tasks and depends on her partner for support. Previously she was employed as a domestic worker in the city but when she got together with her partner she returned to her village.

The loan will be used to purchase a plot of land that she will use to accommodate her animals and also to rent to farmers.

Mercedes dreams of finishing her studies and of obtaining her degree so that she can work. She wants to build her own house and to give her son an education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to accommodate her animals and also to rent to farmers.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs repair work on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires maintenance expenses on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient funds, he is unable to repair his taxi. Therefore Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Fouzia 's husband can afford the repair cost easily. Then he will provide better transport services to earn more profitable income. Fouzia also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's future needs.

Fouzia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Geneflor

texts.en:
Geneflor is 33 years old and married. She has six school-aged children living with her in Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Geneflor sells fresh fish variants in the local community to make a living. He has been doing this job for over 10 years already. Recently, she borrowed  from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fresh fish supplies and fishing nets for her business..

Geneflor hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, she can gain more income and get the chance to build up a small fish stall operated in its own place in the mini-market lane.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish supplies and fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married with five children in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for her family.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, and canned goods..

Maricel has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, and canned goods.

loans.name: Jelene

texts.en:
Jelene is 28 years old and has one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jelene is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Jelene has been pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 39 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman, and five of her children are in school.

Marita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olivia de 43 años de edad, está soltera y tiene una hija que trabaja como secretaria. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta 1° grado de educación básica debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica como para seguir dándole estudio. Únicamente vive con su hija.

Olivia es ama de casa y comerciante,  actualmente tiene 2 años de vender refrigerios a niños inscritos en un programa gubernamental, esto le genera buenos ingresos que son invertidos en la tienda que administra en su casa desde hace 4 años.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de productos para la tienda, azúcar, sal, huevos, granos básicos, golosinas y más para abastecerla. Sueña con agrandar su tienda para que sea su principal sustento.
texts.en:
Olivia, 43, is unmarried and has a daughter who works as a secretary.  She only had a first grade education because her parents did not have the financial means to continue sending her to school. She lives with her daughter.

Olivia is a homemaker and vendor.  Currently she has been selling refreshments to children enrolled in a governmental program. This generates a good income for her that she invests in the store that she has managed in her home for four years.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of products for her store: sugar, salt, eggs, basic grains, sweets and more. She dreams of expanding her store so that it can become her principal source of income.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store: sugar, salt, eggs, basic grains, sweets and more.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet Sarah, 35, a smallholder farmer in Nandihills, which is a small rural area in the Rift Valley of Kenya. She has two children. For the last 15 years, she has been doing mixed farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and other crops. She states that she finds dairy farming and horticulture to be the most enjoyable farming activities. The biggest challenge, however, is the prevailing animal and crop diseases in the region.

Sarah is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. The new farm implements will help Sarah till, plant, cultivate, and harvest crops, significantly reducing the time she spends to accomplish farm tasks. In addition, it will decrease her need for farm workers. She will be able to use the money she would otherwise have paid in salaries, to purchase and maintain the farm equipment. Additional income earned as a result of these developments will go to her children's education.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina de 47 años de edad, estudio un 8º grado, dos de sus hijos no estudian y una está estudiando 6º grado en la escuela de la comunidad,  es madre soltera.
Rosalina trabaja como empleada en una fábrica de concentrados a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa, tiene que madrugar para estar temprano en dicho lugar, trabaja como ayudante en la elaboración de concentrados y otros, en ocasiones tiene que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche por la obligación del trabajo, en este lugar está trabajando desde hace 2 años 
El préstamo que  está solicitando, es para arreglar el techo de la vivienda,  para comprar tejas ya que tiene bastante dañada y quiere mandarla  a arreglar.

Desea darle el estudio a su última hija, ya que quiere que pueda tener un mejor futuro y accesar a un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 47, has an 8th grade education.  Two of her children are not in school, and one is studying in the 6th grade at a local school.  Rosalina is a single mother.

Rosalina works as an employee in a factory that makes animal feed that is located one kilometer away from her house.  She has to get up very early to get there, where she works as an assistant making animal feed and other products.  At times she is obligated to work even to the late hours of the evening.  She's been working there for 2 years.

Rosalina is requesting a loan to fix the roof on her house.  She will buy roof shingles, because the ones she has are quite damaged, and she wants to have the roof fixed.

Rosalina wants to provide her youngest daughter with an education, because she wants her to have a better future and access to a good job.

loans.use: to fix the roof of her house

loans.name: Elsa Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Elsa vive en casa propia con su hijo y su compañero de vida, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una nueva vajilla de platos y sartenes y materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente,  para poder obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Elsa lives in her own house with her son and her partner. She has had a food stall for several years; it is located near her house. She manages to settle her household expenses with the profits she obtains from her sales. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a new set of plates and fry pans, as well as supplies, such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, and vegetables. This will mean she can vary her menu and have a little more income so she can obtain better profits and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a new set of plates and fry pans, as well as supplies, such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, including processed meats such as hot dogs, chorizo, and longaniza

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan of KES 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is 45 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Nancy has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for 35 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds of vegetables, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Joyce has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, Joyce wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Corazoncitos Group

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 14 años y una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, contante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un lugar caracterizado por aglomerar a restaurantes de comida típica y por la elaboración de la ‘Chicha’ bebida fermentada de maíz, de clima semi-tropical, húmedo con un paisaje muy colorido.
Valentina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por el comercio (al centro con una pañoleta celeste en la cabeza). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que es chofer y se dedica al transporte, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo y tienen electricidad y agua de pozo. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores utilidades la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de costura, tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, elaboración de colchones, venta de empanadas y comercio de cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica de lunes a domingo y el menú varía de acuerdo al día. Lunes: escabeche (carne de cerdo hervido). Martes: rellenos de papa (masa de papa con relleno de carne molida). Miércoles: Ají de patas (patitas de cerdo con picante). Jueves: Picante mixto (lengua de vaca y pollo todo picante). Viernes: pique macho (papas fritas, carne de res, salchicha, ají). Sábado: Lomo borracho (carne de res al vino). Domingo: chicharrón de cerdo (carne de cerdo frito). Esta variedad de comidas es una costumbre de su localidad y los clientes ya saben y conocen el menú de antemano. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez años que lleva en esta actividad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio teniendo un restaurante propio, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Valentina solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Valentina, 38, is married and has a son, 14, and a daughter, 9.  She's a good mother and an independent, enterprising, persevering, responsible, and hardworking woman.

Her business is selling traditional food.  She works in the town of Sacaba, a place known for bringing together traditional restaurants and for making "chicha," a fermented corn beverage.  The area is semitropical and humid, and the landscape is very colorful.

Valentina is dark skinned, wears her long black hair in a braid, and dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, pollera skirt).  (She's in the middle, wearing a light blue kerchief on her head.)  Her native language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish because of her business.  

She has made her life with her husband, a driver who earns a living in transportation, and her children, who attend school.  They live in their own house, which is made of brick and has electricity and well water.  The need to earn more profits led her to form a bank with people so they could request a loan and prosper in their businesses: a tailor shop, textiles, fish sales, construction services, mattress production, empanada sales, and cosmetics sales.

Valentina's business is selling traditional food Monday through Sunday, and her menu varies according to the day.  Monday: "escabeche" (boiled pork).  Tuesday: "rellenos de papa" (potato dough filled with ground meat).  Wednesday: "ají de patas" (pork leg with hot peppers).  Thursday: "picante mixto" (spicy cow tongue and chicken).  Friday: "pique macho" (fried potatoes, beef, sausage, and hot peppers).  Saturday: "lomo borracho" (beef in wine).  Sunday: "chicharrón de cerdo" (fried pork meat).  This variety of dishes is customary in her community and her customers are already familiar with her menu.

This is her first loan sequence with the institution in her 10 years in business.  Her dream is to expand her business with a proper restaurant.  Valentina's requesting a loan because she wants to buy tables and chairs to serve more customers and make the most of the end-of-year festivities.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her business and make the most of the end-of-year festivities

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with one child who in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlita is 35 years old now.

Merlita has a buy-and-sell housewares business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items for her business.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her business.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 27 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her household's daily needs. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.

Myla requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Myla has been in the agriculture business for four years, now. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Myla would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 65 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 29 years old and has three children. Mylene is a married woman, and all of her children are in school.

Mylene is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Mylene requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mylene has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат успешно погасила кредит, использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Паризат входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека, в итоге их трое. В хозяйстве Паризат на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 3 телят и 5 овец. На земельном наделе мерою 0,3 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Паризат обратилась повторно в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на постройку большого, теплого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Parizat successfully paid off her last loan after using it for its intended purpose.  She is very grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped finance her loan.  Parizat is a member of the Almaloo group along with two other people.  She currently has a cow, three calves and five sheep on her farm, as well as 0.3 hectares of land to grow corn for her own use.  She's seeking another loan from Bai Tushum Bank of 95,000 som to increase her livestock headcount by buying sheep.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to add even more livestock to her farm, in addition to setting aside money to build a big, warm barn for her animals.

loans.use: buy sheep to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 22 years old. She lives with her parents in Pangani district, in Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students with life skills awareness, to improve their performance. 

Agnes is requesting a Kiva loan to start a business, selling pebbles in her village. Agnes plans to use the profit she will earn to expand her business to wholesale-trading. 

Agnes has big dreams in business. She believes she will come through and the Kiva loan will change her life.

loans.use: to start a pebble business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her store with a variety of drinks to sell

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Oscar de 48 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, una hija de 14 años que estudia 7° grado de educación básica y un hijo 8 años que estudia 2° grado de educación básica. Él estudió hasta 1° año de bachillerato, sus padres siempre le dieron el apoyo para estudiar, pero él no siguió porque prefirió trabajar para comprar sus cosas. Su esposa además de ser ama de casa vende ropa confeccionada; solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

 Oscar es comerciante, tiene 14 años de vender medicina natural, también vende ropa confeccionada. Comenzó vendiendo verduras en el mercado, después trabajó para una empresa distribuidora de ropa, pero resultaba muy pesado el trabajo, hasta que inicio con la venta de medicinas. Se desplaza a los distintos municipios del departamento donde vive, recorre distintas distancias, antes lo hacía a pie pero gracias a los frutos de su trabajo ahora lo hace en motocicleta.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 3 cajas de vitaminas bebibles, 3 de vitaminas inyectables y 3 frazadas para el frio ya que es parte de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Oscar sueña con ampliar su vivienda, construir dos habitaciones para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar, 48 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has two children, a daughter, 14, who is in the 7th grade and a son, 8, who is in the 2nd grade. Oscar, himself, studied up until the first year of high school. His parents always supported his studies but he did not continue because he preferred to work in order to buy his own things. His wife, aside from being a housewife, also sells ready-made clothing. Only she and his children live with Oscar.

Oscar is a merchant. He has been selling natural medicine for 14 years; he also sells ready-made clothing. He began selling vegetables at the market. Afterwards he worked for a business distributing clothing, however the work ended up being quite difficult so he began selling medicine. He travels to different municipalities of the department where he lives and covers different distances. Formerly he went on foot, however, thanks to the fruits of his work, he now does so on his motorcycle.

The loan will be used to purchase three boxes of liquid vitamins, three of injectable vitamins and three blankets for the cold since these are part of the products that he offers to his customers. 

Oscar dreams of expanding his dwelling and of adding on two bedrooms for his children.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of liquid vitamins, 3 of injectable vitamins and 3 blankets for the cold.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en: Salud has been operating her retail store for many years and has been able to sustain the business. She has supported her family and made some home improvements to provide a more comfortable life. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods. She hopes to expand her store by renovating for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 27 years old and married. She has five children and resides in Lopez Jaena, with her family. She is peddling fresh fish in the local community, to make a living. For over nine years, this activity has sustained and provided her children's education costs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying fish to sell.

Now, Marites is taking a new loan, to buy fishing nets used for fishing. She hopes to earn more income and be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 26 years old and has two children. Rica is a married woman and her two children are in school.

Rica is in the agricultural business of raising pig in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rica has been in business for 2 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 39 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. Valentina works very hard to provide for them.

Valentina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. Valentina has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods. 

Valentina is committed to rebuild and, in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 40 years old.

Vilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vilma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is 31 years old. She is a Camfed guide, volunteering to work with secondary school students, helping them to identify their potential and to improve their learning and performance. 

Zuhura also runs a poultry business from her home. She has a hut where she keeps her chickens and then sells them when they grow. Zuhura likes her business. She was inspired by her mother because this business requires only a small amount of capital to start it. 

Zuhura is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing more chickens and to build a bigger hut. She plans to use the profits to support her families' basic needs such as good meals and health care.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more chickens and to build a bigger hut.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married mother of seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. With a loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cooking oil, sugar, and flour for her business. 

She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: Jose de 46 años vive solo en casa propia, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 46 years old and lives alone in her own home. For 10 years he has owned a bakery located in his home. He has  many customers because of the quality of his bread. With the earnings he obtains he will be able to meet his household expenses. He seeks a loan  to buy flour, sugar, jellos of various flavors, etc. in order to continue working and in this way better income resulting in a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jellos of various flavors, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old. She lives with her parents in Gairo District in Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide. She works with secondary school students by helping them understand life skills and self-awareness in order to increase their learning performance in school. 

Elizabeth also has a shop where she sells household goods. She uses the profits she obtains to help her parents with household expenses and to pay school fees for her siblings. 

Elizabeth is requesting a Kiva loan to increase the stock in her shop, She plans to use the profit she will earn to build her own shop store and provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crockery, chairs etc. for her food-selling business

loans.name: Dúo La Brigada Group

texts.es: Dúo la Brigada La encargada de este grupo es la señora Eulalia quien desde hace 3 años se dedican a la venta de tamales, paches, chuchitos, Panes,  refacciones en general.  Su sueño es tener una gran venta de refacciones con sus empleados en su colonia y al contar con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y la razón de vivir que son sus cuatro hijos, le da gracias a Dios por la venta que tiene.  Varios pedidos de tamales le han hecho pero el tomate, las hojas de plátano, papa, y especies como el ajonjolí, la pepitoria, no le alcanzan. Por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para poder comprar lo que le falta y aprovechar los pedidos que tiene para tener muy buenas ganancias. Su compañera la señora Blanca de 33 años de edad.
texts.en: Dúo la Brigada. The woman in charge of this group is Eulalia, who for 3 years has been selling tamales, paches and chuchitos (traditional Guatemalan dishes),  bread, other snacks. Her dream is to have a large snack business with employees in her neighborhood. She has the unconditional support of her husband and her 4 children are her reason for living. She gives thanks to God for the sales that she has. She has various orders for tamales but the tomato, banana leaves, potatoes, and spices such as sesame and pepper won't last. Therefore she needs a loan to be able to buy what she needs and take advantage of the order that she has in order to have good income. Her partner in the loan group is 33 year old Blanca.

loans.use: to buy food products to make snack foods.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 54 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 29 years old and lives with her mother in Kilombero District, Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in a local secondary school, teaching students life skills in order to help them understand the importance of a quality education. 

Aziza is a tailor who makes women’s clothes. She also designs for her customers. Aziza uses the income she earns to support her family’s livelihood. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a modern sewing machine and fabrics for her customers. Aziza plans to use the profit she will earn to renovate her working space and care for her family.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including scissors, milk, cigarettes, eggs, coffee, pulses, glue, and other things to sell. 

She started her business in 2012 with her own working capital of $250. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to have good management to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin so she can have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy scissors, milk, cigarettes, eggs, coffee, pulses, glue, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
Hadiya is borrowing from IMON for the first time. She is a very hardworking and industrious woman. Hadiya is an entrepreneur. She has been busy with own business for more than twelve years. She has a beauty salon. Hadiya also offers wedding dresses for rent to fiancées. She opened this business twelve years ago for supporting her husband. 

Hadiya and her husband are bringing up four children. They always try to offer good living conditions to their children. Hadiya is going to change the windows of her house to plastic windows because plastic windows keep the house warm. Also, she must buy a heater for the winter season. 

Hadiya is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy plastic windows and a heater for her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and a heater for her house.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde desde hace 30 años, tiene muy buena clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos del hogar, Jose  vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, el ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar 2 novillos de engorde que le permitirá crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 48 years old and has been raising cattle for 30 years. He has many customers and with the income from his sales he is able to pay his household expenses. Jose lives in his own home with his wife and four children. He has decided to invest in caring for his cattle as this is his business, so he seeks a loan to buy 2 calves to fatten which will permit him to grow his business, resulting in better income.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves to fatten.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya esta su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, y tiene muchos clientes fijos, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is 55 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and son. For 10 years he has been farming corn. When it is harvest time he sells it in neighboring villages. He has many regular customers. Jorge is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticide, herbicide, etc. in order to be able to continue with his crops as farming is his only source of work and this way he will have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean  is 42 years old and married with three children and lives in Aloran with her family. She has a retail store that sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income. 

She has been six  years in this field. She is working well every day in order to provide income for the family and to help improve their living situation.

Jean requested this  loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains for sale in her store in order to increase her sales. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she could possibly repair their house for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains for sale in her store in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Angelene

texts.en:
Angelene is a very dedicated woman who wants to become successful in the future. She studies Hotel and Restaurant services in a university.

She took this loan from GDMPC  to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. She wants to become a successful hotelier and she believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. In the future, she wants to become successful with her family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 48 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. NIlda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc..

Nilda has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister from Iringa District is 25 years old and married with one child. 

She is a unique young woman in her community because of her volunteering spirit in helping students understands their well-being and life skills in order to boost their aptitude for learning. She has become popular in her village due to her work. Students call her a teacher while she is just a volunteer. 

Felister has a poultry. She purchases chickens and keep them until they grow big enough to sell them at a wholesaler. She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her chicken stock, renovate the hut, and purchase food and vaccines.

loans.use: To increase her chicken stock, build a hut, and purchase vaccines.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo de 64 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, ambos estudiando uno bachillerato y el otro en la universidad. Él estudió hasta  2° de educación básica debido a que sus padres no pudieron seguir dándole el estudio. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Rodolfo es agricultor, siembra granos básicos, también trabaja con ganado, aprendió de sus padres que siempre lo llevaron a trabajar, tiene cerca de 30 años trabajando de esta manera, para llegar al lugar de trabajo camina cerca de 15 minutos, los fines de semana le ayudan sus hijos, los demás días trabaja con jornaleros de 6:00 am hasta 1:00 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para contratar mano de obra para limpiar los potreros, para que crezca pasto para su ganado. Rodolfo sueña con que su hijo termine su carrera universitaria y comprar más vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 64 years old, is married and has two children; both are studying, one in high school and the other in college.  He studied until 2nd grade of elementary education because his parents could not continue giving him an education.  His wife is the caretaker of the house, and only she and their children live with him.    

Rodolfo is a farmer.  He plants basic grains.  He also works with cattle.  He learned from his parents who always took him to work.  He has close to 30 years working experience.  To reach his work place, he walks about fifteen minutes.  On the weekends, his children help him.  The other days, he works with laborers from 6:00 am until 1:00 pm.  

This loan will be utilized to hire labor to clean the paddocks, so that he can grow pasture for his cattle.  Rodolfo dreams of his son finishing his college degree and buying more dairy cows.

loans.use: To hire labor to clean the paddocks.

loans.name: Dúo Ana De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Ana de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Ana quien tiene una venta de pollo desde hace tres años. Contando con el apoyo de su esposo y la ayuda de dos hijos desea alcanzar su sueño  que es tener un local en la calle principal de su colonia.  Los pedidos de pollo están aumentando cada día y los que tiene ya no le alcanzan, tiene dinero pero no le es suficiente para comprar los demás pollos que le faltan por tal motivo necesita otro préstamo para comprar más pollo y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.  Su compañera la señora Marleni de 25 años de edad.
texts.en: Dúo Ana de Vista Hermosa.  The woman in charge of this duo is Ana. Ana has had a business selling chicken for 3 years. She has the support of her husband and the help of her two children. She wishes to achieve her dream of having a location on the main street in her neighborhood. The chicken orders are increasing every day and she doesn't have enough to sell. She has money but not sufficient to buy the rest of the chickens she needs. Therefore she needs another loan to buy more chickens and not disappoint her customers. Her loan partner in the Duo is 25 year old Marleni.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Roida is 36 years old and a single mother of three children. Roida is a Camfed Learner Guide; she volunteers in a secondary school helping students understand life skills to boost their performance. 

She is a farmer and a young businesswoman cultivating green peppers and selling them to retail suppliers in local markets. Roida uses her profit to cover household expenses and pay school fees for her children. 

She requests a Kiva loan to purchase pesticides for her plants and to expand her farm. Roida plans to use the profit she will earn to employ a person to help her with the farm work.

loans.use: to expand her business farm and purchase pesticides for her plants.

loans.name: Orlando Enrique

texts.es: Orlando de 47 años de edad, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado en la zona donde reside tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, Orlando  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Orlando, 47 years old, has raised cattle for 20 years in an area where he lives.  He has very good clientele since he knows how to earn the trust of his customers.  He lives in his own house with his two children.  

Orlando has decided to invest in the care of his cattle.  Therefore, he has applied for a loan to be able to buy vitamins and to buy more cattle that will allow him to grow in his business and, thus, have a better income.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and more cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Zuleyma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Zuleyma de 29 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos, de 12, 10, 7 y 2 gemelos de 4 años de edad, estudian 5°, 4° y 3° grade de educación básica, los dos menores no estudian. Ella estudió hasta 3° grado, no continuó porque su padre las abandono y su madre no podía darle el estudio. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Zuleyma no tiene ninguna actividad económica, depende de una pensión que les dan a sus hijos y de los ingresos de su esposo. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 12 pliegos de láminas, 3 libras de clavos de 3 pulgadas y con el resto pagara la mano de obra para reparar el techo de donde está ubicada su cocina, al llover filtra el agua porque la lámina esta picada.

Zuleyma sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante en medio de la pobreza y aplicar cemento al piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Zuleyma, 29 years old, is married and has 5 children, ages 12, 10, 7, and two twins who are 4 years old.  They study 5th, 4th, and 3rd grade of elementary education; the younger two are not in school.  She studied up to the 3rd grade; she did not continue because her father abandoned them and her mother could not give her an education.  Her husband works as a laborer, and only he and their children live with her.

Zuleyma does not have a job.  She depends on a pension that they give her children and on the income of her husband.  The loan will be utilized to buy 12 sheets of foil, 3 pounds of 3-inch nails, and with the rest she will pay for the labor to repair the roof where the kitchen is located.  When it rains, it will filter the water because the foil has holes in it. 

Zuleyma dreams of her children getting ahead in the midst of poverty and applying cement to the floor in her house.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheets of foil, 3 pounds of 3-inch nails, and with the rest she will pay for the labor to repair the roof where the kitchen is located.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Merlina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 23 years old, and lives in Kilombero District in Tanzania. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at her local secondary school, helping students understand life skills in order to boost their attendance and performance at school. 

Asha is a young businesswoman selling palm oil. She buys palm seeds and produces palm oil which she sells at wholesale and retail. 

Asha is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase containers for packing and to hire one person to help her with the business. She plans to use gained profits to pay for her college fee and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase containers for packaging.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 22 years old, living with her parents in Kilombero District in Tanzania. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering to helping and advising learners to improve their performance and attend school regularly. 

Agatha has a bicycle for rental business. She depends on her business’s profits to purchase more bicycles for rent. She is requesting a Kiva loan to rent a business space where she can store her bicycles. She wants to use future profits to employ one person to assist her with the business.

loans.use: To rent a storage space for her bicycles

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is 59 years old and unfortunately for ten years already she has been a widow, but fortunately she has two glorious sons and she lives with them in her native Kapan city of Syunik region. As she says she is very proud both of them, who are already adult men and they take care of her so cutely, tenderly, and with great respect. 

Raisa many years worked at the knitting factory, and now she works at the theater as a property worker. Her elder son lately got married and he lives with his family separately now. Only Raisa’s smallest son  lives with her and he simultaneously works in two places, at the theater and at the local hospital as an electrician. 

Raisa now impatiently waits until her second son also gets married, since he already has a very pretty girlfriend. Raisa has made some savings during several years and she wants to change the interior of her house a little bit, particularly her guest-room, but without some more financial support she can’t manage. 

She asks a loan of 200,000 AMD (Armenian drams) in order to buy guest-room furniture, to make it more comfortable and attractive.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the guest-room, to make it more comfortable and attractive

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and has seven children. She is a married woman and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar, ha utilizado los préstamos para ir mejorando su negocio de transporte de electrodomésticos, con dicha actividad genera recursos económicos para tener lo necesario junto a su esposa y mantener un buen record en el uso de créditos.
Requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar llantas nuevas para el pick up, realizara los viajes con mayor seguridad y dará un mejor servicio, espera tener resultados positivos con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Cesar has used the loans to continue improving his business of transporting household appliances.  With said activity he generates economic resources to have what he needs with his wife and to maintain a good record in the use of loans.  

He requires a new loan to buy new tires for his pickup, he will to make travel safer, and he will give better service.  He expects to have positive results with this new investment.

loans.use: To buy new tires for the pickup, he will make travel safer, and he will give better service.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos reside en la comunidad desde pequeño vivió con sus padres con quienes trabajo por muchos años en la agricultura y la crianza de especies menores. Estudio hasta curto grado y no pudo seguir debido al  conflicto armado que sufrió el país en esa época.  su esposa se dedica a la comercialización de tortillas las cuales vende en el pueblo donde reside, es padre de dos hijos de los cuales uno ya no estudia y el otro si estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. 


Carlos se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y maicillo) desde los trece años de edad cuando su padre le enseño dichos cultivos, ya que era el hermano mayor de sus hermanos y tenia que salir desde tempranas horas a trabajar la tierra.

Cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijoles. Hoy en día también trabaja en los cultivos de café en unas fincas que hay en la zona de donde obtiene ingresos económicos para darle a su familia mejores condiciones.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz, para el negocio que posee su esposa de la venta de tortillas en la comunidad, y a la vez necesita invertir en la compra de dos cerdos para engorde.

Con ello mejorara los ingresos, pues sus ventas se verían incrementadas ya que hay bastante demanda, y con los cerdos espera venderlos dentro de cinco a seis meses para ir obteniendo mas ingresos.

Carlos sueña con construir su vivienda de adobe para tener otras condiciones de vida y así darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios para que se preparen académicamente y puedan trabajar en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos has lived in the community since he was a small boy. He lived with his parents who worked farming and raising small animals for many years. He completed 4th grade in school and couldn't continue because of the armed conflict that happened in his country during that time period. His wife sells tortillas in the town where they live. He is the father of two children, one of whom is no longer in school and the other attends the neighborhood school.

Carolos has grown basic grains (corn, beans) since he was 13 years old when his father taught him how. As he was the oldest child in his family he had to leave in the early morning hours to work the land. He grows 7000 square meters of corn and 3500 of beans. Today he also works on the coffee crops on one of the farms in the area, providing additional income to give his family better living conditions.
