The loan he seeks is to buy corn for his wife's tortilla business and at the same time he needs to invest in buying two pigs to fatten. With this he will improve their income, as their sales will increase as they have increasing demand. He hopes to sell the pigs within 5-6 months to obtain more income.

Carolos dreams of building an adobe home in order to have better living conditions and give his children a better quality of life. He hopes to continue supporting his children's education so they are academically prepared and can work in better conditions along side their family.

loans.use: to buy corn for his wife's business and two pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres de Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Ingrid quien tiene una pequeña venta de medicina como jarabe para la tos, fiebre, malestares del estomago, sueros en litro, en sobre, pastillas para todo dolor y enfermedad, capsulas para tratamientos de personas con malestares o alguna enfermedad.  Contando con el apoyo de su esposo sigue luchando por su sueño más grande que es  llegar a tener una farmacia en su colonia ya que no hay ninguna.  Tiene la necesidad de comprar más pastillas por caja, también inyecciones, sueros y jarabes, el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso necesita otro préstamo y así no fallarle a las personas que la buscan para comprar medicina. Su compañera la señora Liria de 26 años de edad.
texts.en: Dúo Mujeres de Buena Vista. The woman in charge of this group is Ingrid. She has a small business selling medicine such as syrup for cough, fever, upset stomach, serums by the liter, pills for pain and illness, capsules for various infirmities. She has the support of her husband to continue working toward her dream of a larger business of a pharmacy in her neighborhood as currently there is not one present. She needs to buy more boxes of pills, injections, syrups and serums. The  money that she has won't last so she seeks another loan so she won't disappoint her customers seeking medicine from her. He loan partner in the Duo is 26 year old Liria.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 22 years old, and she lives with her parents in Kilolo District in Tanzania. She gives back to her community by volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide. She works with secondary school students and helps them understand vital life skills in order to boost their learning performance in school. 

Juliana is a businesswoman and owns a small restaurant where she makes her living. Juliana is requesting a Kiva loan to hire one person to help her with the business. Juliana plans to use profits accumulated from the Kiva loan to open a boutique shop and support her family with living costs.

loans.use: To hire a person to help her with the business

loans.name: Rosauro

texts.en: Rosauro is a man who stands out by searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow him to feed his family. Three years ago he began selling homemade cakes with his wife, and then later he developed a store of leather products. He thanks God and his clients for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and his products well-liked. Rosauro is asking for a loan to buy more leather products to sell. He wants to buy a vehicle to be used for the business.

loans.use: to buy more leather products to sell.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is a businesswoman from Dipolog. She is 28 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Rodelia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rodelia continues to look for better business opportunities to make ends meet for her family. She is exploring backyard gardening for added income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and other sewing materials to expand his business.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, está acompañado, tiene un hijo de 16 años el cual está estudiando 9° grado, viven en una misma casa; desde hace 23 años cuenta con un negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y comercialización de ganado, actividad que aprendió de su padre, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., ya es muy reconocido en su localidad por las actividades que realiza.
Será de ayuda el préstamo para comprar una novilla, que engordara para posteriormente venderla a un mejor precio, también adquirirá insumos agrícolas para dar un mejor trato a sus cultivos y tener una cosecha abundante, espera tener ingresos mayores y mantenerlos estables para subsistir con su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio, cumplir con todas sus responsabilidades, dar a su familia mejor alimentación, educación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Lucio is married and has a 16 year old son who is studying in the 9th grade.  They live in the same house.  For 23 years he has had a business of farming basic grains and livestock marketing, which he learned from his father.  His schedule is from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  He is already widely know in his locality for the jobs that he performs.  

This loan will help him to buy a heifer that he will fatter to later sell at a better price; he will also acquire agricultural inputs to give a better deal on his crops and to have an abundant harvest.  He hopes to have better income and to keep it stable to take care of his family. 

He dreams of having a larger business, fulfilling all of his responsibilities, and giving his family better food, education, and clothing.

loans.use: To buy a heifer that he will fatten and later sell at a better price; he will also acquire agricultural inputs to give a better deal on his crops.

loans.name: Kastria

texts.en: Kastria is from Iringa District. She is 25 years old, and a single mother of one child. Kastria is a Camfed Learner Guide, helping students understand life skills so that they can concentrate on their studies and improve their learning performance. In addition to this, she runs a grocery shop. Kastria uses her profits to provide for her child. She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her shop's inventory and employ one person who will run the business when she goes to purchase new stock in the city. Kastria plans to use the profit obtained from the loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to increase her shop's inventory and employ one person who will run the business when she goes to purchase new stock.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Judy. She comes from Kaptumo, situated in North Rift, Kenya, where she runs a mixed-farm on an acre of prime, fertile land. 

Judy is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 that she will use to purchase poultry and to construct a rabbit hutch. The loan will be of meaningful impact in her business. The assets she seeks to acquire will add on to the two cows, 15 chickens and tea crops already on the farm. 

Income generated from this investment will enable Judy to help her husband of 10 years provide for their family of four children.

loans.use: to buy poultry and construct a rabbit hutch.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is a father of three who operates a farm, growing and selling rice to earn a living. He has been in this business for many years and he earns well for his family. He took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest. He plans to expand the farm by having more rice plots in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She is a Camfed learner guide in a secondary school. She helps vulnerable girls who are at risk of dropping out of school to stay in school by helping them work through their challenges and concentrate on their studies. 

Maria has a mobile phone shop where she sells accessories such as chargers, batteries and phone covers. Maria was motivated to start this business by her husband. Her community looks at Maria as an entrepreneur who strives to grow her business. She purchases her stock in town.  She uses her profits to support her husband with living costs and help her parents with food supplies. Maria is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To expand her business to be a wholesale supplier of mobile phones.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 47-year-old, married father of four children who works in an association which specializes in dealing with people with special needs since 2006. His main job aims at making wheelchairs, since he previously used to work as a mechanic and has special talents in this domain.

Haytham has a special case with his leg, and he works hard not to let it be an obstacle that might limit his development and success at work.

Today, Haytham is acquiring a loan which is part of Al Majmoua's Damej program, designed to finance people with special needs who are developing their own business or are setting up a new business with the purpose of empowering them and integrating them in the labor market.

It targets: 
-People with physical disabilities 
-Parents or family members of a disabled person, under the condition that the loan will be for the benefit of the disabled person (ex. Home or business rehabilitation to fit the disabled person’s needs)

By supporting this loan, you're enabling Haytham to make necessary maintenance to his balcony's floor to keep it suitable for his special health conditions and facilitate his living.  He hopes that in the future he can open his own grocery store and develop his family's living as much as he can.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his balcony's floor to keep it suitable for his special health conditions.

loans.name: Almare

texts.en: Almare is 39 years old and married with three children.  She resides in Oroquieta with her family. She is peddling fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over five years, it has been sustainable and has provided her children's education costs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fish to sell. She is now taking a new loan to buy more volume of fish to sell. She hopes to earn more income and to be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Winfrida Honolatusi

texts.en:
Winfrida is 22 years old and a single mother of three children.  She also cares for her three siblings who depend on her. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills to improve students’ aptitude to learning. 

Winfrida is a businesswoman selling charcoal near her home. She currently uses her profits for household expenses and taking care of her children. Customers appreciate Winfrida because she is hardworking, very kind, and always respectful of everyone in her community. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more charcoal in bulk. She intends to use the profit she will accumulate as a result of the Kiva loan to help her children and siblings with their social and economic needs.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 34 years. She is married to Alfred and together they have been blessed with five children between 17 and 2 years old, respectively.

Caroline is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Caroline has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy goats for raising.

With the anticipated profits, Caroline will be able to repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have an improved life and see her business growing from one level to another.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan would like to take another loan to buy more beverages to sell from her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Maragly's Group

texts.en:
Maragly is a 46-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband has been running a general store for many years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Maragly's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore Maragly has applied for a Kiva group loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Maragly is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of commodities for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 62 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional variety of bananas to plant and sacks of fertilizers.

Marilyn has been farming bananas for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of bananas to plant and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is 25 years old and the mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing household.

Nosheen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase the fruits. 

Therefore, Nosheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit for reselling purposes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a woman who stands out by searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. Six years ago, she began making woven nipa. She thanks God and her clients for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and her products well-liked. Based on this success, Elena is asking for a loan for the purchase of more raw materials and woven nipa products to resell in town. She plans to be a supplier of woven nipa in the market in town to gain more income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials and woven nipa products to resell in town

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has two children. She earns a living through her dressmaking business. Her husband earns income through his tricycle business. Beatriz is in need of additional capital for the businesses. She is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of the tricycle and to buy materials for dressmaking such as cloth, needles, thread and others. With the loan, Beatriz will be able to make more dresses and her husband will be able to transport passengers with their tricycle. 

She hopes to improve their way of living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's  tricycle and to buy materials for dressmaking such as cloth, needles, thread and other items

loans.name: Monah Jane

texts.en:
Monah Jane is a 20-year-old single woman.

To earn a living, she has been selling fish in her village. Through her business, she has been able to help and support her parents.

She is seeking a loan to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing operations. She is hopeful that she will generate additional income as a result of the loan to build a house for her future family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing new fishing nets

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials. Sang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and increase her income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to further expand her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, with the help of this loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional sewing materials

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this. With her previous loan used for buying livestock to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. She has repaid successfully her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to buy livestock feed to boost her pigs. She is now happy to say that she is assured of a productive piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed to boost her pigs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 52-year-old mother of five in Kaptumo, Kenya. She started farming 40 years ago, which is around the same time she got married to her septuagenarian husband, Samwel. She keeps three cows and five poultry on the farm that produce milk and eggs for both consumption and sale. She has employed two farmhands to help her run the enterprise.
 
Esther is looking to develop the state of the poultry by constructing a housing for the hens. She will then buy more hens to produce more eggs for sale. To actualize this plan, she has turned to Kiva lenders seeking a loan investment of KES 20,000. Any amount spared after this project will help her purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer. 

Through hardwork and determination, Esther believes that she will one day be able to provide her family with a better quality of life, which is different from the one she grew up in. The increased income will go to her children's education to further their endeavors for a brighter future.

loans.use: to develop and grow her poultry farm and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her shop.

loans.name: Dúo Eden Group

texts.es: Dúo Eden. este grupo esta formado por la señora francisca de 45 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles desde hace varios años, es una persona que ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de muebles ya que sus clientes han aumentado y le han encargado muebles de diferentes diseños y no tiene el capital suficiente para hacer el pedido, entonces esta solicitando este credito esperando que le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en:
This group, Dúo Eden, includes Francisca, 45 years old. She has been working in the area of furniture sales for several years. She is a person who has struggled so her family could get ahead. 

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy furniture because she has gotten more customers. They are asking her for different designs and she doesn't have the necessary capital to place the order. So she is requesting this loan with the hope that you can help her with her business.

loans.use: To buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 22 years old, She is married and lives in the Pangani district of Tanzania.

She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school, where she teaches students life skills in order to boost their future performance.

Currently, Nuru does not have a business, but she is planning to start a cosmetics business. As a result, she is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase inventory for her shop and to pay rent for a store space.

loans.use: To establish a cosmetics business by purchasing inventory and renting store space

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 40 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a butcher by profession; he sells beet and mutton in the local market. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Mumtaz's husband needs to purchase meat in bulk for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase meat to fulfill his business needs. Therefore, Mumtaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy meat from the slaughterhouse to resell in the market.

loans.name: Enosh

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Enosh, a 56-year-old caring, honest and hard-working father of four children, who hails from the Kisii area of Kenya. Enosh is a very hard-working farmer who is easy to get along with.

He has been farming for the past ten years. During this time, he has never looked back, because he has been making good profits and taking great strides in terms of farming. Enosh practices mixed farming -- that is, crop and dairy farming -- and, through these ventures, he has been able to earn a decent and honest income. He is an early riser who wakes up very early to go to his farm because farming is the only way that he can earn a living.

Enosh has identified space on his farm that he wants to fully utilize through dairy farming. This is why he is kindly requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kisii is an area that has a high population and a high demand for milk. Enosh, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that and to be able to earn extra income. He hopes that the extra income generated from the loan proceeds will allow him to improve his family's standard of living and to expand his milk-selling business. Through the increased profits he expects from the loan, Enosh is planning to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk for additional sales.

He wants to be economically empowered but, being a smallholder farmer, he knows that accessing funds is challenging. However, knowing that there are partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, he feels relieved and knows that all his dreams can be achieved, which would allow him to provide a secure future for his children and to improve his family's living conditions. Enosh patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To expand his dairy farming operations by purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, se dedica a la pesca y a comercializar diferentes tipos de mariscos, vive en la zona costera con su esposa e hijos; toda la familia desempeña está actividad, su esposa se encarga de atender un atienda en su vivienda, no tiene un horario para realizar la pesca, las dificultades son cuando la marea esta alta y en la época de invierno. Actualmente no representa problemas.
Invertirá en bebidas, boquitas, sal, azúcar, papel higiénico, pan, etc., y dará mantenimiento al equipo que utiliza para salir a pescar, espera tener mayores ingresos económicos y disminuir las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus objetivos son ser un ejemplo de persona luchadora en su hogar y comunidad, mantener su negocio con vida, pagar su deuda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
David works as a fisherman and sells different types of shellfish. He lives in the coastal region with his wife and children. His whole family is involved in the business; his wife is in charge of a store in their home. There is no set schedule for fishing, but it is difficult during high tide and in the winter. Currently that isn't a problem. 

He will invest in drinks, snacks, salt, sugar, toilet paper, bread, etc. and will maintain the equipment he uses to go out fishing. He hopes to increase his financial income and reduce the needs in his home. 

His objectives are to be an example of a hard-working person in his home and community, keep his business alive and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: To invest in drinks, snacks, salt, sugar, toilet paper, bread, etc. and to maintain the equipment he uses to go out fishing.

loans.name: José Adan

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, es el octavo de 12 hermanos,  es una persona muy  trabajadora, en su juventud fue muy trabajador, él  siempre quiso estudiar pero sus padres por falta de solvencia económica no lo pusieron a la escuela, él a una corta edad como lo son 15 años se acompañó con una muchacha del pueblo de su misma edad, actualmente ya tienen muchos años de estar juntos. Su esposa  actualmente se dedica a la actividad de tejer hamacas las cuales sale a  vender al pueblo y por encargo,  actualmente ellos son padres de familia tienen dos hijos uno de 13 años y el otro de 3 años de edad el más grande de ellos ya asiste a la escuela  de la localidad.

Él se dedica a destazar cerdos gracias a que su hermano mayor desde pequeño  le enseño esta actividad, todas las personas de la localidad acuden a él cuándo necesitan que les destace algún cerdo, él  recibe ayuda de su esposa quien le ayuda en el destazo, los días que no destaza trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos y ademas apoya a su esposa a tejer hamacas por las tardes libres.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cerdos de engorde ya que es una actividad  muy rentable para generar ingresos a la familia y otra parte del crédito lo necesita  para la compra de hilo de seda ya que su esposa lo necesita para la fabricación de las hamacas.

Él planea a futuro trabajar con ganado, comprar algunas vacas para el sustento diario, y también   arreglar la vivienda en donde vive actualmente, ya que la casa donde están ahorita con su familia es de su hermano, y por supuesto apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old, and the eighth of 12 children.  He is a very hard worker.  In his youth he worked very hard, and he always wanted to study but his parents, for lack of sufficient funds, were not able to enrol him in school.  At the early age of 15, he moved in with a local girl of the same age.  They are currently still together after many years.  His wife is currently involved in the weaving of hammocks which she sells to people in town and through especial order.   They are now parents and have two children, one aged 13 and the other 3.   The older one is currently attending the local school.

He works as a pig butcher because his older brother, since childhood,  taught him this activity.  All local people come to him when they need a pig to be butchered.  He also gets help from his wife in this activity.  On the days when he doesn't butcher, he works in agriculture in the production of basic grains and he also helps his wife to weave hammocks on his free afternoons.

The loan he is requesting is to buy pigs for fattening as it is a very profitable activity to generate income for the family.  Part of the loan he will also use to purchase thread because his wife needs it to manufacture hammocks.

In the future, he plans to work with cattle, buy some cows for daily sustenance, and fix the home where he currently lives, as the house where they are right now with his family belongs to his brother.  He also would like to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening and silk thread since his wife needs it for the manufacturing of hammocks.

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en: Stumai, age 26, is a single mother of one child. She has three relatives who depend on her for food and school fees in Kilosa District, Tanzania. Currently, she is volunteering in a nearby secondary school helping students with life skills awareness. To support herself, she is a tailor with three years of experience. Stumai decided to start this business because she was trained as a tailor and the demand for clothes is throughout the year. She is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business. She intends to use the profits from her business to provide school fees for her child and improve the lives of her family and siblings. She has a dream of expanding her business and to live a better life.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to Dominic, who earns additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.

To earn a living, for five years, Mary has been both a livestock farmer and an agricultural farmer. By doing so, she typically earns income in the amount of approximately 5,000 KES per month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a friend and is now servicing her first loan in the amount of 5,000 KES through VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan proceeds to buy animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers. Mary plans to use the anticipated income generated from the loan to pay for her children's school fees. More generally, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her farming operations by purchasing animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilian Francisca

texts.es:
Lilian de 32 años de edad,  es una persona trabajadora, ella  solo  pudo estudiar hasta  noveno  grado de educación básica, por falta de solvencia económica por parte de sus padres, desde pequeña solamente se crio con su padre ya que su mamá falleció cuando ella era muy pequeña de edad, ella junto a su padre se dedicaban al comercio. Ella actualmente es madre de dos hijos y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella se dedica a la cosmetología, aprendió la actividad durante un curso que recibió en una academia  la cual era gratuita por parte de la  alcaldía del municipio de donde vive  ella, también se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual es la actividad de donde tienen más  experiencia porque es la que realizaba con su padre desde muy pequeña. Ademas se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos de lencería para todas las edades.

Rl préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisetas, short, pantalones, ropa interior de hombre y mujer. Para surtir más su negocio ya que ella ve que es muy rentable  y genera muchos ingresos a su familia, ella pretende poner un puesto  fijo y como también salir  a vender a otros pueblos aledaños.

Ella planea tener su negocio  estable y brindarle educación necesaria a sus hijos para que puedan ellos  tener un empleo digno o tener su propio negocio el cual  les genere ingresos para su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Lilian, 32, is a hardworking person who has only a 9th grade education, as her parents could not afford to send her to school. She was raised by her father from the time she was very young, because her mother died when she was a young child.  Lilian used to work alongside her father in trade.  Now she is the mother of 2 children, and her husband works in construction.

Lilian works as a cosmetologist, an activity she learned through a class that she took at an academy.  This class was offered free of charge by the government of the municipality where she lives.  She also works selling clothing, which is the activity where she has the most experience, because she did this with her father from the time she was very young.  In addition to selling clothing, she also sells lingerie for all ages.

The loan that Lilian is requesting will be used to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, shorts, pants, and underwear for men and women, so that she can stock up her business, which is very profitable and generates a lot of income for her family.  She plans to establish a sales stall as well as go out to sell in the surrounding towns.

Lilian plans to have a stable business so that she can provide her children with the education that they need to have a decent job or to run their own business, so they can generate income for their daily lives.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad es una mujer responsable que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 16, 15, 8 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante al lado de su familia, por medio de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años por lo que ha logrado hacerse de una muy buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos por la calidad de estos y la amabilidad con la que son atendidos. El corredor de la vivienda de Rosa es de tierra y en tiempos de lluvia la tierra se convierte en lodo provocando insalubridad en su vivienda, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso del corredor y así evitar la insalubridad que este causa en temporadas de lluvia. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado en el marco de las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a responsible, 35-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her life companion and their 4 children, ages 16, 15, 8 and 7. She is a woman who has known how to get ahead, along side her family, thanks to her business selling beauty products. She has had this business for 3 years and has managed to attract a good number of customers who always seek out her products for their quality and her friendliness in waiting on them. 

The veranda at Rosa's house is made of dirt and during the rainy season, it turns to mud, which creates an unhealthy condition in her home. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of the veranda and avoid the unhealthy condition that the floor causes in the rainy season. 

She appreciates the support she received in the past related to improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of the veranda

loans.name: Blanca Marleni

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene una venta de fruta de temporada, oficio que aprendió y heredo de su madre, lo desarrolla con su esposo, es casada, vive con su esposo, 4 hijos y su madre de avanzada edad, quien ya ha dejado de trabajar, todos dependen de los ingresos que le genera su negocio.
Invertirá en jícamas, camotes, ayotes y otras frutas de la temporada al por mayor, así podrá recuperar lo invertido con mejores ganancias, piensa utilizarlas para resarcir su deuda, brindarles educación a sus hijos y seguir cuidando de su familia. 
Sueña con tener un negocio más estable que se mantenga funcionando y generando los ingreso necesarios para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Blanca has a stand selling seasonal fruits and vegetables, an occupation she learned and inherited from her mother. She and her husband run the business. She is married and lives with her husband, four children, and her elderly mother, who is no longer working.  Everyone depends on the income that their business generates. 

She will purchase jicamas, sweet potatoes, pear squash and other seasonal fruits and vegetables at wholesale.  This way she will be able to recover what she has invested through better earnings, which she intends to use for paying off her debt, providing her children with an education, and continuing to look  after her family. She dreams of having a stable business which will keep operating and generating the necessary income to meet their commitments.

loans.use: To purchase jicamas, sweet potatoes, pear squash and other seasonal fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Diofanor

texts.es:
Carlos es un campesino de 50 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un cultivo de café que asiste todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Liborina, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y su esposa. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha. 

Carlos, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 50 year old, hardworking, humble man from the country who learned to work in the fields when he was a boy, thanks to his parents.

This has allowed him to progress and he now has a coffee crop that he tends to daily and sells the harvest in the Liborina market plaza.  He also works as a laborer at different farms in the region so he can have enough to provide for his wife’s and children’s wellbeing.

With the help of this loan he will buy farming supplies in quantity, such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and other things so he can continue to care for his crops and have a better harvest.

Carlos, with his entrepreneurial spirit, drive, and tenacity, wants to continue to strive to achieve his dream of having a farm of his own, where he can raise a much greater variety of products and be able to increase his business’ profitability.  This will guarantee financial stability for a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Nazan

texts.en:
Nazan is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three children. Her children are doing studies. 

Her husband has been running his own garment business for many years; he is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Nazan is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for reselling purposes. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nazan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy garments for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 20, is single and living with her parents in Handeni District, Tanzania. To give back to her community, Saumu is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who helps students understand life skills. Saumu also helps her parents on the farm. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a poultry business because she believes that through the business of selling chickens, she will change her life. She plans to use the profits obtained from the loan to help her parents on the farm and to support her family with household expenses.

loans.use: to start a poultry business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 22, is married and has one child. She lives in Gairo District in Tanzania with her family. Emma is a Camfed Learner Guide who uses her time to explain to students the importance of studying hard and the negative impacts of dropping out of school. 

To support herself, Emma has a shop for home groceries, where she sells items such as flour, soap and rice. Emma would like to expand her business and she believes Kiva will change her life in this way. Thus Emma is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk. She intends to use the profit to pay school fees for her child and buy food for her parents.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
This pretty lady is 22 years old and her name is Monika. She lives with her husband in Yerevan city. This young couple is just married and they have no children yet.  Monika is a sophomore in the magistracy at the Yerevan State University at the paid division, and she is a specialist of English and Spanish languages. She is a very clever and punchy young lady, and she already gives private paid courses of Spanish language; she has a small group of students. 

Her husband works at the pizzeria as a barman. As Monik says, with their small and very tight budget, her education fee is a rather serious problem for their young family. She asks for this loan in an amount of 210,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her tuition fee for the first semester. She and her husband thank beforehand all the Kiva lenders for the really great help.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 23 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Kilosa District, Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school, helping students understand life skills that will enable them to improve their performance. 

To support herself, Prisca sells vegetables and fruits in a local market. She uses her profits to pay household expenses for her family and siblings who depend on her. She requests a Kiva loan to purchase varieties of vegetables and fruits to sell in the market. The profits obtained from the Kiva loan will improve her business and enable her to employ one person to supervise the business when she goes to farmers to get new stock.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of vegetables and fruits to sell in the market.

loans.name: Moza

texts.en:
Moza, age 30, is a mother of one child living in Rufiji District, Tanzania. To support herself and her child, she runs a pharmacy shop in her village. Previously Moza was employed in a pharmacy but she used her salary to support herself to complete pharmacist training for her to start her own pharmacy. She likes to see healthy people in her village. 

Moza is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her pharmacy. She is planning to use the profits to buy medicine in bulk and repair her shop. She wishes to own a nice and big pharmacy shop. Moza also volunteers in a local secondary school helping learners improve their well-being with health and life skills education.

loans.use: to increase stock in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie is 53 years old and married with three children. She resides at Oroquieta City with her family. She owns and operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for many years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. She is now taking a new loan to repaint and buy a new brake pad for her motorcycle for safe travel with customers. Vergie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy another vehicle to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repaint, and buy a new brake pad for her motorcycle for safe travel for her customers.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de pescado en un pequeño puesto ubicado en el municipio de Carepa, estos productos los vende con el afán de encontrar una actividad que le genere ingresos para su sostenimiento y apoyo en su hogar.

Siempre había sido muy inquieto y curioso con el área de la comercialización y aunque es poco su capital, siempre está dispuesta a avanzar y trabajar tenazmente para progresar.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de pescado al por mayor para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos mejores ingresos. 

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Luis is a young entrepreneur with a great desire to get ahead and progress.

He has been selling fish from a small stall in Carepa for two years.  He does this in order to earn an income with which to support his family.

He has always been restless and curious about selling and even though he has little capital, he is always ready to move ahead and work tenaciously in order to make progress in his life.

He is asking for this loan to buy fish in quantity in order to increase his inventory, improve his sales, and have a better income.

He hopes to be able to get ahead with the help of people with good hearts who support these types of plans.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Manuel es un trabajador empírico de la electrónica. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de la observación y el ensayo de sus técnicas.

Ofrece sus servicios desde su casa a los habitantes del municipio de Sincelejo.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el valor del trabajo duro y la responsabilidad y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para surtir comprar cables e insumos para la reparación de aparatos electrónicos, esto le permitirá mantener el material suficiente para continuar trabajando.

Con tu aporte Manuel Podrá progresar en su negocio!
texts.en:
Manuel is a hardworking electrician.  He learned much from watching others and working his skills

He offers his services from his home to the residents of Sincelejo.

He is a very hardworking and honest man who knows the value of hard work and responsibility and for this reason he always tries to provide excellent, efficient, and good quality service.

He is asking for a loan to buy cables and supplies to repair electrical devices.  This will allow him to keep enough supplies so he can continue working.

Manuel will be able to move ahead in his business with your support!

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Angy Paola

texts.es:
Angy es una joven de 25 años de edad que se dedica al negocio de vender alimentos en el sector de puerto triunfo, como pueden observar en la foto es un terreno muy humilde pero esta joven quiere crecer y aspirar a mejor negocio que le servirá para darle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una educación de calidad. 
El sueño de angy es poder tener un restaurante y con la inclusión social que tiene interactuar en su sector residencial ve este sueño más cerca por tal razón solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas y utensilios para consolidar mejor su negocio y esperar que este prospere con le paso del tiempo convirtiéndose en un lugar insignia.
texts.en:
Angy is a young 25 year old woman who sells food in the Triunfo Port area.  As one can see in the image, it’s a very humble area but this young woman wants to grow and aspires for a better business that will allow her to provide her son with a quality education.

Angy’s dream is to be able to have a restaurant and she sees this dream a little closer, given the social interaction she has in the area.  She is asking for a loan to buy tables, chairs, and utensils to consolidate her business, have it prosper, and turn it into a landmark.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.es:
Edilma es una mujer de campo, emprendedora y luchadora la cual ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando. 
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para compras algunos Pollos para cría y para la construcción de su galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su sostenimiento.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Edilma is a hardworking and enterprising country woman who has had to face many adversities in her life.  However, she has always had the strength to move ahead and continue making progress.

She has wanted to start raising and selling chickens for some time, so she is asking for a financial breath to buy some chickens and also to build a chicken coop.

This business will allow her to earn an income with which to support herself.

She will work every day to move the business ahead and make it sustainable and profitable.

Help out a hardworking woman with a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Sara Alejandra

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende ropa para dama y caballero. Inicio el negocio hace 1 año y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de ropa de diferentes marcas con las que actualmente no cuenta.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Sara is a woman who had put down many stakes with which to face the world and have a good life thanks to her efforts.

She has a store where she sells men’s and women’s clothing.  She started a year ago and even though she has been doing this for a short time, she has had good results.

She would like to expand her offering of goods and improve her sales by injecting some capitol into her business.

She will use the money to buy an assortment of clothing of various brands that she doesn’t currently have.

She has great expectations for her business and believes that she will be able to improve it considerably, thanks to the support of these entities that make it possible for people to dream about better and more stable lives.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 42 years old, and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a butcher by profession; he sells beef and mutton in the local market. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Fatima's husband needs to purchase meat in bulk for resale purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position he is not in a position to purchase meat to fulfill his business needs. Therefore Fatima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy meat from a slaughterhouse for re-sale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a 30-year-old businesswoman from Morogoro District in Tanzania. She is married and has one child. 

To give back to her community, she volunteers in a local secondary school in her village, helping children to pursue their education by teaching them how to tackle challenges in and outside of school so they can perform well in their studies. In addition to providing local students with tutoring, she helps other young women to fight poverty by giving them business education. 

Fortunata also owns a Mobile Money Transfer business. She uses the profits to help her parents with food, clothes and health care. She is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business. 

The profits that Fortunata will generate from the loan will enable her to expand her business reach in her community and neighbouring villages.

loans.use: To expand her business reach in her Mobile Money Transfer business

loans.name: Nhóm 10- Yên Doãn 1 Group

texts.en:
Dung is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10- Yên Doãn 1 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 2 loans from them already.

Dung has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make iron furniture to sell. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make iron furniture to sell

loans.name: D'marie

texts.en: D'marie is 47 years old and has five children. She resides in Oroquieta City with her family. She sells gasoline in their village to make a living. In her free time, D'marie started doing hairdressing in her own salon and liked it a lot. Her dream is to do "delivery hairdressing." D'marie needs a loan to pay the rent for her beauty salon. She plans to build her own beauty salon to make her business safe and comfortable.

loans.use: to pay the rent for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Efrosina

texts.en:
Efrosina is a 32-year-old lady and is married to Johny, 31 years old. They have three children - Ongky, 11, 5th grade of elementary school; Adel, 7, 2nd grade of elementary school; and Yandri, 4.

In addition to being a housewife, Efrosina spends her days cultivating plants at the farm. She cultivates string beans, mustard greens, peanuts and corn. From her farming activities, she recently harvested string beans, mustard greens, peanuts and corn and sold them at the nearest market. The income from selling the harvest was spent on meeting their household needs and educational expenses. 

Efrosina plans to cultivate more plants, and therefore she needs more capital to do so. She has submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Nhóm 20-Thạch Tiến-Quảng Thạch-Quảng Xương Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 33 years old and is married with two children. Nhung lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 20-Thạch Tiến-Quảng Thạch-Quảng Xương Group. Nhung works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale. In 2013, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. Nhung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale

loans.name: 40 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thùy is 30 years old and is married with four children. Thùy is the group leader of the 40 Hưng Bắc Hưng Lộc Group, which consists of six members. Thùy operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for five years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. In 2012, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Thùy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old. He is married to Mercylline and together they have been blessed with two children aged two years and eight months respectively.

Charles is a farmer, a business he has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500.

Charles has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 27,000, which he will use to add stock of cereals like rice, green grams (mung beans), sugar, and tea leaves.

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to repay his loan as well as expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have an improved life and see his family prosper.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals like rice, green grams, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Grace has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gentlemen. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece a los vecinos de la comunidad productos de la canasta básica, ella realizo la apertura del negocio hace 2 años, por motivación de un amigo, mantiene un horario de atención de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m., la ventaja es que ella sola administra el negocio y está más al pendiente de los productos que tiene mayor demanda; su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad.
Comprará aceite, azúcar, sal, arroz, productos enlatados, etc., así ofrecerá nuevos productos que sean de ayuda para aumentar las ventas, al suceder esto sus ganancias serán mayores, tendrá mejor capacidad de pago y cubrirá las necesidades básicas familiares. Los riesgos son los índices delincuenciales en su localidad.
El sueño de Milagro es mantener su negocio surtido para tener clientes satisfechos y lograr estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Milagro owns a shop where she sells staple goods to her neighbours in the community. She opened her business two years ago after a friend encouraged her to do it. Milagro works from 6am until 7pm. She manages the business herself and so she knows which products are most in demand. 

Milagro is married, and has two children, ages ten and eight. 

Milagro will use this loan to buy oil, sugar, salt, rice, tinned good and more in order to offer new products that will help to increase sales. With higher sales, Milagro will earn higher profits, she will have higher purchasing power, and she will be able to cover family expenses. The risk to the business is the presence of delinquents in the area.

Milagro's dream to is to keep her business stocked up in order to keep customers satisfied and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, salt, rice, tinned good and more in order to offer new products that will help to increase sales.

loans.name: Balvina Elias

texts.es: Balvina es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque Chimaltenango. Desde hace más de diez años se ha dedicado a la crianza de pollos y cerdos y por media de este oficio ha encontrado la manera de apoyar a sus hijos para q vayan a estudiar. El lugar donde vive es un área propicia para el mantenimiento de este tipo de animales. El sueño de Balvina es hacer un corral más grande e implementar también la crianza de pavos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de concentrado, pollos y cerdos.
texts.en:
Balvina is originally from San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. She has been raising chickens and pigs from more than ten years. This has helped her to support her children and their studies. The local conditions are good for raising these animals. Her dream is to enlarge her pens and start raising turkeys too.

She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy chicken and pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of her house and change the locks on the door.

loans.name: Wilton Omar

texts.es:
Wilton de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de bachillerato, y ya no pudo seguir con sus estudio universitario por falta de solvencia económica, ya que sus padres no podían pagarle la universidad porque es muy cara.

Wilton decidió mejor trabajar y se dedicó a lo que es hacer viajes en carro particular, actualmente es padre de familia  de 2 niños uno de 2 años y el otro de 3 años de edad, su esposa se dedica solamente a los  quehaceres del hogar.

Él desde que estudiaba ya realizaba viajes a personas  particulares en sus tiempos libres cuando no tenía clases, desde pequeño le ha gustado manejar ya que su padre le enseño.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar el carro donde hace los viajes, ya que se le ha dañado y por el momento se ha quedado sin poder trabajar en los viajes que realiza a otras partes del municipio y además necesita realizar otros arreglos al vehículo.

él planea a futuro poder comprar un microbus propio, ya que el que le presta es muy pequeño y no caben muchas personas en él y también poder comprar  un terreno para constuir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Wilton, 24 years old, studied through the third year of secondary school and he couldn't continue with a university education due to economic insolvency, since his parents couldn't pay for university because it is very expensive. 

Wilton decided it was better to work and decided to provide trips in a personal car. He is the father of two children, one is 2 years old and the other is 3 years old and his wife works only in the household tasks.

Ever since he was still in school, he already transported people in his free time when he didn't have classes. Since he was young, he has liked to drive since his father taught him how. 

The loan that he is requesting is to repair the car he uses for the trips, since it is damaged and at the moment he is left unable to work in providing the transportation that he does to other parts of the municipality and, in addition, he needs to do other repairs on the vehicle.  

In the future, he plans to purchase his own minibus, since the one he is borrowing is very small and not many people fit in it, and also to be able to purchase a plot to build his own house.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses to make the trips, since it is damaged and at the moment he is left unable to work.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 38 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace 5 años con sus cultivos de loroco, papaya y chile, dichos productos los vende por mayor en su vivienda, ya que sus clientes saben de la calidad de los productos. Él se siente feliz de poder contar con su negocio en su vivienda, ya que esto le permite estar más cerca de su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad con los que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 38 años. En la vivienda de Manuel son muchas las cosas que necesitan de una reparación, pero sobre todo la pila y el baño ya que son tan vitales para la calidad de vida, es por ello que él desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra para construir un baño y una pila en su vivienda ya que él considera que es mejor volverlos a construir que repararlos por el grado de deterioro que tiene. Con el crédito anterior solamente logró cambiar parte de la cañería, agradece el apoyo recibido por parte de la institución.
texts.en: Manuel is 38 years old and is a hardworking man who has earned his living for the past 5 years with his loroco [local greens], papaya and chile crops. He sells these products in bulk from his house, since his customers know the quality of his products. He is happy to be able to have his business in his house, since it allows him to be closer to his life partner and their two children, ages 1 and 3. He lives with them in his own house, where he has lived for 38 years. In Manuel's house there are many things that need repairs, but above all the pila [large water basin] and the bathroom, since they are so vital for the quality of life. For this reason, he wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and pay labor costs to build a bathroom and a pila in his home since he thinks it is better to rebuild them instead of repairing them due to the amount of deterioration that they have. With the previous loan, he only managed to replace a part of the pipes. He is thankful for the other support he has gotten from the institution.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and pay labor costs to build a bathroom and a pila [large water basin] in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her postgraduate studies and finish her degree,

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Irine operates a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to people from her town and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Irine dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: 020001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên has a retail business selling fruit. Liên is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Liên is the group leader of the 020001.Yên Phong solidarity group which consists of 4 members. 

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Maya Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for the Maya Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their standard of living at the same time.

Zainab is a 25-year-old married mother of one child who started working as a tutor a year ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Zainab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees. 

With respect to the other group members, Mona is the lady sitting on the right, Maya is the lady standing on the right, Dalia is the lady standing on the left, and Zainab is the lady sitting on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran, Molave, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with three children. Her business is an internet cafe, and she serves those students who does not have their own computer for their paper work like  encoding, printing and research. She has had this business for 10 years with a monthly income of Php 15,000 which she has used for the studies of her three children.

Ellen requested a loan to buy another computer to meet the demand of her clients. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ellen hopes that God will bless her business so that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy another  computer for her internet cafe

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 20-year-old single man who has been working as a chef in an Orphans association since July 2011, with six years of experience in this domain.

Bilal had vocational training to improve his cooking skills, and he is working hard to keep on developing himself so that one day in the future he can open his own restaurant.

Today, Bilal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his brothers and sisters' school tuition fees. Bilal is the main financial support for his family, since his father is employed in a company where he didn't get his salary paid since four months and no one knows how long this issue will last.

Bilal's responsibilities are increasing, that's why he is working hard to develop his career to make sure that he can cover his family's increasing needs.

Bilal might also use part of this loan to do necessary maintenance to his parents' house before the coming winter season to keep it  a healthy living place.

loans.use: To pay for his brothers and sisters' school tuition fees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. 

She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario de 57 años de edad,  se dedica  a la agricultura cuya actividad la realiza desde muy joven, él logro estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación media, por las noches ya que en ese tiempo estaba la guerra civil y era muy difícil estudiar, él se casó a los 28 años de edad y  tubo junto con su  esposa  dos  hijas y dos hijos.  Él actualmente está pensionado, ya que en el tiempo de la guerra sirvió y gracias a ello actualmente recibe una pensión del estado.

Él se dedica actualmente al comercio de pan ya que desde muy  joven aprendió esta actividad, ya que recibió un curso de panadería que lo impartió personal de la alcaldía de donde vive él, y cómo era muy inteligente aprendió muy fácilmente esta actividad, actualmente produce pan tanto pan francés como pan dulce para la venta, pero como la demanda es  mucha compra pan en otro municipio  y lo revende en otros zonas aledañas.

El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar harina, huevos, manteca, levadura  y lo demás del crédito lo ocupara para la compra de cerdos, ya que siempre ha  querido dedicarse a esta actividad ya que es muy rentable sabiéndola administrar.

Él planea a futuro poder comprar otro vehículo,  ya que el que tiene ya no da abasto a la demanda que tiene de pan, y necesita otro para poder cubrir más zonas y así poder obtener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hilario is 57 years old, and makes a living as a farmer. He has worked in farming from a very young age. He managed to study until the 4th grade of middle school education, attending classes at nights because there was a civil war at the time and it was very difficult to study. He got married at the age of 28 and had two daughters and two sons with his wife. He currently receives a state pension because he served during the war.

Today, Hilario also makes a living as a baker, a trade he learned from a very young age when he undertook a bakery course given by staff at the town council where he lives. As he was very intelligent, he learned the activity very easily and currently makes French bread and sweet bread for sale. However, as demand is so high, he buys bread from another town and resells it in neighbouring areas.

He is requesting the loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, and yeast, and to buy pigs, as he has always wanted to work in this activity because if you know how to manage it, it can be highly profitable.

In the future, he plans to buy another vehicle as he is unable to meet the demand for bread, and he needs to be able to cover more areas and in this way, make more money for his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, and yeast, and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in two doors, sheets of corrugated metal, wood, and nails to change two doors and the roof of her house

loans.name: Dúo Adonai Group

texts.es: Dúo Adonai Es conformado por las señora Hilda Carolina, es  madre de una niña de 8 años,  doña Hilda líder de este dúo se dedica a la elaboración de blusas para damas, niña, y señoritas, este tipo de blusas es en un estilo moderno y a un precio  bien accesible para las mujeres, ella logra sacar entre 4 o 5 blusas semanas vendiéndolas a un precio de Q.150 cada una, además se dedica a la venta de medicina y nos expresa que a Dios gracias se recibió como enfermera auxiliar, logrando ofrecer colocar sueros e inyecciones a las personas que la conocen. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas para la elaboracion y venta de blusas
texts.en: One of the members of the "Dúo Adonai" group is Hilda Carolina who is the mother of an 8 year old girl. Hilda is the leader of this group and she works making blouses for women, girls and young women. Her blouses are in a modern style and at an affordable prices for women. She manages to make 4 to 5 blouses per week and sells them at 150 GTQ apiece. She also sells medicine and she stated that thanks to God  she had become a nurse's aide. She gives serum and injections to people that she knows. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric to make and sell blouses.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make and sell blouses.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 27 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a sari-sari store that sells different goods like feed, school supplies and food. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to restock her store with sacks of feed, schools supplies and canned goods for more sales to sustain the needs of her family. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Divina dreams of having a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with various merchandise like sacks of feed, school supplies and canned goods.

loans.name: Nhom 02 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Nghĩa works in agriculture rasing poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale. 

Nghĩa is 50 years old and she is married with one child. Nghĩa is the group leader of the Nhom 02 thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2013, Nghĩa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nghĩa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nghĩa has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nghĩa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree course, which will benefit her family through the better job opportunities it will offer her.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a sari-sari store and has had this business for 15 years. She wants to be engaged in a farming activity. 

Josephine requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation to earn more income and reduce the risks of farming and enjoy her farming activity. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Josephine wants to engage in more businesses to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Rubidia Lorenza

texts.es:
Rubidia tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos los cuales viven con ella y de los cuales solo 2 estudian, Rubidia estudio hasta tercer grado, se ha dedicado al comercio en lo que es la venta de pescado y otro tipo de comercio, su esposo es agricultor.

El negocio de Rubidia es vender pescado, hortalizas y otros, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace cuatro años lo aprendió de una amiga que la invito a vender, y gracias a eso Rubidia pensó en salir a vender, y así puede ayudarle a su esposo en los gasto y ya no depender unicamente de los ingresos de su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pescado, queso, pan y verduras. Y con otro poquito desea poner una pequeña tienda en la comunidad donde pueda tener dinero extra para su familia.

 El sueño de ella es en poder seguir trabajando y poner crecer con el negocio y desea a corto plazo vender mas y tener personas que le ayuden para crear fuertes de ingreso para otras familias
texts.en:
Rubidia, 43, is married.  She has three children who live with her, only two of whom are in school.  Rubidia studied up to third grade.  She has earned a living selling fish and other types of commerce.  Her husband's a farmer.

Rubidia's business is selling fish, vegetables, and other products.  She has done this job for four years.  She learned it from a friend who invited her to make sales, thanks to which Rubidia decided to go out and do it.  That way she can help her husband with the expenses and not depend exclusively on his income anymore.

The loan she's requesting is to buy fish, cheese, bread, and vegetables.  With a small part of the loan she wants to set up a small store in the community so she can have some extra money for her family.

Rubidia's dream is to be able to keep on working and to grow with her business.  In the short term, she wants to sell more and have people help her create sources of income for other families.

loans.use: to buy fish, cheese, bread, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 40,000 that she is requesting,  she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio
