texts.es:
Mauricio de 38 años de edad, esta acompañado su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar, él solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiado, Mauricio se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, tanto sus hijos como su compañera de vida dependen económicamente de los ingresos de Mauricio.

El trabajo que realiza de agricultura y albañilería lo aprendió de su padre, dichos trabajos los aprendio a los 16 años. Mauricio camina alrededor de 30 minutos para llegar a lugar donde tiene su cultivo. Su compañera de vida le ayuda en el trabajo de campo desde la 6.00 AM hasta las 11.00 AM

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, y también quiere comprar 2 terneros para repasto y así aprovechar el zacate de la milpa. Con esto el cliente espera cubrir las necesidades básicas  de su familia.

El sueño de Mauricio es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y puedan crecer en la vida enseñándoles a trabajar y ser personas de bien, desea mejorar su vivienda para tener una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 38 years old, is in a relationship with his life companion who does housework. He only managed to study up to Grade 9. He has four children who are all studying. Mauricio works in agriculture and as a bricklayer. Both his children and his wife depend on Mauricio's income.

The agriculture and bricklaying work he does he leaned from his father when he was 16 years old. Mauricio walks about 30 minutes to get to the place he has his crops. His life partner helps him with the work in the fields. He works from 6 am until 11 am.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertilizer, manure and he also wants to buy two calves to make use of the fodder from his corn. Doing this the client hopes to pay for the basic necessities for his family. Mauricio's dream is to help his children study and help them grow into good people teaching them how to work. He wants to make improvements on his house to have more security.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and he also wants to buy two calves to take advantage of the fodder from his corn.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, vive acompañado padre de dos hijos, su pareja estudio hasta octavo grado, y se dedica a los oficios domésticos, Fidel en cambio se dedica a la venta de pan y a la agricultura, lleva diez años dedicándose a estas actividades, para la venta de pan tiene que viajar en motocicleta a una distancia de diez kilómetros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar herbicidas, semilla y abono para tener una cosecha abundante. El sueño de Fidel es tener su casa propia, sacar a sus hijos adelante, prepararlos académicamente y darles una vida digna.
texts.en:
Fidel is 29 years old and left education after the third grade. He lives with his partner and two children. His partner studied until the eighth grade and looks after the household. Fidel works selling bread and also in farming. He has done these activities for ten years. To sell his bread, he has to travel some ten kilometres by motorbike.

He is requesting the loan to buy weedkiller, seeds and compost for an abundant harvest. Fidel's dream is to have his own home, support his children, prepare them academically and give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy weedkiller, seeds and compost for an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Virgie  is from the village of Eastern Poblacion Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, married and operates a business venture selling fish to make a living. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns well from these activities. She took a new loan to buy new fishing nets for fishing. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets  for fishing.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 26-year-old woman married to Nzomo who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Juliana has been a farmer for a period of three years, earning herself an income of KES. 5,000 at the end of every month.

Juliana was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 5,000. She intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers, seedlings and animal feed.

Juliana plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings and animal feed.

loans.name: Nurys Isabel

texts.es:
Nurys, radicada zona rural del municipio de Chigorodo, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva varios años con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos. 

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus 5 hijos a quiénes desea darles educación de calidad.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nurys lives in a rural area of the municipality of Chigorodo. She has always worked in agriculture along with her family from whom she learned this occupation. She has been raising pigs on her own for a number of years to distribute and sell in the various parts of the community.

She dreams of improving the number of pigs to raise so she has requested a loan from the Institution so that she can purchase a number of pigs and supplies to feed and sustain them. The income from this increase in animals will allow her to have a higher living standard without financial difficulties. Her 5 children depend on her business and she wants to provide them with a quality education. Her big dream is to own her own house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a number of pigs and food and sustenance for them.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Shazia has also been doing her business of clothes selling for many years and contributes her income, along with her husband, to help manage the household.

Shazia needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in a position to buy these clothes for her business purposes. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for reselling.

loans.name: 06-01-15 Chợ Nam Thành , Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc has a retail business selling thongs. Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more thongs to resell.

Cúc is 48 years old and she is married with two children. Cúc is the group leader of the 06-01-15 Chợ Nam Thành, Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Cúc has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to travel for vacation internationally.

loans.use: to purchase more thongs to resell

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 63 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. She has enjoyed doing her farming activity, with the impact that her children finished their studies through this business. She has had this business for 35 years. 

She requested a loan to buy three sacks of fertilizers and inputs to make her rice healthy and for more harvest. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Concordia wants to help others and supply rice in the city.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizers and inputs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a hardworking father from Panalsalan, Plaridel. He is 64 years old and has a small business. Victor and his wife have joined forces to put up their own junk store. When Victor started the business, he thought that the secret of buying and selling scrap materials was to be able to identify the type of scrap that he would sell. When it comes to metals, Victor knew how he could double his income. He would also know the rusty tin cans, cooper, broken steel, and plastics. They can put together broken appliances and salvage the motors of cars, everything that could still be of use, and earn from it. 

Victor has signed his membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to purchase scraps, plastics and empty bottles, and add working capital for his junk shop business. Victor hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for his family. In the future, he dreams of buying land to have a wide space for his business and a hauling truck for his delivery.

loans.use: to purchase scraps, plastics and empty bottles and add working capital for his junk shop business

loans.name: Tahiya

texts.en:
Tahiya is a 53-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started 15 years ago working in selling clothes to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Tahiya is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new winter collection. Her loan will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones.

Tahiya hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a specialty collection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

Minh is 63 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mình faces in her life is not having money to repair her latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick in order to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick in order to build a toilet

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support for her family. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman and she has children, all of whom attend school. Rosalia owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rosalia operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 10 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Maria y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria is a very enterprising woman with a great desire to move forwards and make progress.

She has worked selling catalogue products such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and household goods for 10 years. She mainly sells these products to friends, neighbours and family members who know Maria and also want her activity to develop.

From a very young age, she felt a great affinity for trade and sales, which is why she has good skills in this field thanks to her friendly nature and excellent customer service.

She is requesting a loan to buy more stock of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and improve her sales, thus obtaining a good income to contribute towards household expenses.

She hopes that she can succeed thanks to the support of those good-hearted people who support these kind of projects.

loans.use: to but more stock of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba was born in 1968. She is a very kind woman. Nasiba is divorced and brings up two non-adult children alone. She lives with her children in a house she has bought by herself. 

Nasiba began her own business deal with cooking and selling rolls 10 years ago. She cooks rolls in her house and sells them in a local market. Nasiba cooks variety of rolls, and her cookies are tasty. She has regular customers, thanks to the high quality rolls. She improves her living conditions little by little. 

Nasiba is going to change the doors and windows of her house to plastic doors and windows. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy plastic doors and windows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy plastic doors and windows

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene la edad  de 47 años, esta casado, vive con sus hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café , además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mario is 47 years old. He is married and lives with his children, who are his first priority. With his loan, he intends to buy fertilizer and fungicides and pay for labor to help with work on the coffee crop. He also intends to take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the climate conditions, and other factors that favor coffee cultivation. With these improvements to the crop, he hopes to earn a little profit and thus improve his family's living conditions, invest a little more in the crop, and also achieve some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for supplies, manure, and crop spraying

loans.name: Eniza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Eniza desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la cria de pollos y tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos pollos, cerdos y alimento para los mismos que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es madre responsable y amorosa con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposo quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
Eniza has done farm work such as working in agriculture and raising animals since she was very young.  Her father taught her these business activities so that she could get ahead in her life.

Nowadays her primary business activity is in agriculture and raising chickens.  Her objective is to improve her capital by purchasing some chickens, pigs, and animal feed that will allow her to stock up and generate better earnings.  This is the reason she is requesting a loan.

She is a responsible mother who is very loving with her children.  She live on a farm with them and her husband, who has been her greatest companion.

She dreams of being able to give her children a quality education so that later on they are able to take care of themselves and become independent.

She tends to her business every day, and she strives to do things very well.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: 06-08-01 Mật Sơn 3, Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thủy has a business selling furniture for people who have died. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase material to make furniture for people have died (coffins) for sale. 

Thủy is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 06-08-01 Mật Sơn 3, Đông Vệ solidarity group. 

Thủy lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to build a new house, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase material to make coffins for sale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance repairs to his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Razia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily, and then he will be able to provide better transport services to earn more profitable income. 

Razia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Razia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To incur the expense of her husband's taxi repairing.

loans.name: Consentidas De 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Susy es una mujer de 34 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijas de catorce, diez y ocho años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 16 de julio, un lugar céntrico caracterizado por conectar a todas las demás zonas mediante transporte publico de todo tipo. De clima frío aproximadamente doce grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3750 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Susy es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro como la noche; largo y trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio (sentada, con mandíl rosado). La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de licores, venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva y tienda de barrio, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar las utilidades de sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; ají de papalisa (papalisa, arroz, carne molida y ají), anticucho (corazón de res ensartada en un alambre a la parrilla con ají de maní), Chairo (sopa de chuño), fricasé (sopa de cerdo), peske (quinua con queso y leche), etc. su negocio lo inicio frente a la casa de su madre porque existe una parada de buses y mucho tránsito de personas, ya son cinco años que viene realizando esta labor en el mismo lugar, al aire libre, sólo tiene un toldo (sombrilla) que la protege del sol y un poco de la lluvia, además de media docena de bancos, donde los clientes se sientan para comer agarrando el plato con la mano y una cuchara en la otra. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución desde que inició su labor. Su sueño es tener un restaurante reconocido, ella desea refaccionar un cuarto viejo que consiguió en alquiler para utilizarlo como restaurante, este se encuentra en malas condiciones; el techo está dañado, le falta revoque en las paredes y tiene ventanas sin vidrios. Es por esos motivos que Susy solicita un préstamo para refaccionar su futuro restaurante y dejar de vender comida en la calle.
texts.en:
Susy is a 34-year-old woman, married, who has three daughters who are fourteen, ten, and eight years old. Her business is selling food.

She is strong, persistent, tenacious, responsible, and hard-working. She performs her work in the 16 de Julio zone, a central area characterized by connecting all of the other zones through all types of public transportation. It has a cold climate of approximately twelve degrees Celsius during the whole year and an altitude of 3750 meters above sea level.

Susy is of dark complexion, medium height, with hair black as night, long and braided. Her form of dress is traditional (a hat, blanket, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish because of her business (seated, with a pink apron). 

The necessity of increasing her business led her to form a bank made up of people with businesses such as: a stand selling food, selling liquors, selling sweaters, knitting baby clothes, selling French fries, selling sports clothes, and a neighborhood store. This was to request a loan and improve the usefulness of their activities.

Her business is selling food such as: ají de papalisa (papalisa, rice, ground beef, and broth), anticucho (beef heart skewered on a wire, grilled, with peanut broth), Chairo (soup made from freeze-dried potatoes), fricasé (pork soup), peske (quinoa with cheese and milk), etc. She began her business in front of her mother’s house because there is a bus stop and a lot of pedestrian traffic. It has already been five years that she has performed this work in the same place, outside. She only has a toldo (parasol) that protects her from the sun and a little from the rain. Also, there are a half-dozen benches where the customers sit to eat, holding the plate with one hand and a spoon in the other.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution since she began her work. Her dream is to have a well-known restaurant. She wishes to remodel an old room that she acquired to rent to use as a restaurant. It is in bad condition: the roof is damaged, it is missing plaster on the walls, and it has windows without glass. It is because of this that Susy is requesting a loan to remodel her future restaurant and stop selling food on the street.

loans.use: to remodel her future restaurant and stop selling food on the street.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lưỡng works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for future selling.

Lưỡng is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children. Lưỡng is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2014, Lưỡng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lưỡng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women before this.

Lưỡng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lưỡng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lưỡng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future selling

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She is 54 years old, married, and has an 18-year-old son. 

Marina is engaged in retail sales of vegetables, eggs, canned goods, seasonings, and other items. This is the source of her income.

Marina wants to expand her business. To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, eggs, canned goods, seasonings, and spices. With the loan, Marina will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Marina has hopes of making her business more stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, eggs, canned goods, seasonings and spices

loans.name: Ngọc

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Ngọc is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngọc has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Ngọc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her life is not having a clean water system or a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Ngọc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: 06-01-14- Chợ Nam Thành, Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Dung is 42 years old and is married with 2 children.

Dung is the group leader of the 06-01-14- Chợ Nam Thành, Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Dung operates a food stall selling fruit. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years and supports 2 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dung hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Kim works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Kim has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 1999, Kim joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Kim has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Kim hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Hương lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfume and other items).

loans.name: Nhài

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhài is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhài works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Nhài has been involved in this business for 5 years.

This is Nhài's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Nhài faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment for toilet and bathroom and to repair latrine/toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Nhài hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment for toilet and bathroom and to repair latrine/toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Jarlesky

texts.es:
La Joven Jarlesky se dedica al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio cuenta con una pequeña cafetería la cual atiende personalmente desde hace un año, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio ya que sus principales clientes son empleados de la fabrica que esta continuo a su negocio.
Jarlesky su principal venta de producto son los taquitos de pollo, enchiladas, baleadas, burritas, desayunos, almuerzos, etc. necesita el préstamo para la compra de pollo, repollo, tortillas, salsas, queso, aceite, frijoles, mantequilla, harina, etc. y con el apoyo del préstamo  espera surtir su negocio de producto y esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas, también gracias a la calidad de sus comidas la demanda de clientes ha aumentado y no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para cubrir con la demanda de estos.
Jarlesky sueña con poder reparar la caseta y comprar unas vitrinas para exponer mejor su producto al público.



Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras octubre 2014
texts.en:
Young Jarlesky makes a living in trade. Her main source of income comes from her business. She has had a small cafe which she personally runs for a year. She gets up very early to look after her business as her main customers are employees at the factory next to her business.

The main products Jarlesky sells are chicken tacos, enchiladas, tortillas, burritos, breakfasts, and lunches. She needs the loan to buy chicken, cabbage, tortillas, sauces, cheese, oil, beans, butter, flour, etc. With the support of the loan, she hopes to be able to stock her business with products. This will help her boost her sales. Thanks to the quality of her food, customer demand has increased and she doesn't have enough working capital to cover this demand.

Jarlesky dreams of being able to repair her booth and buy some display cases to better show off her product to the public.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras, October 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, cabbage, tortillas, sauces, cheese, oil, beans, butter, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh works to grown fruit trees for 5 years.

Thanh is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
She does not have a latrine and requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

Thanh hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Nargisa

texts.en:
Nargisa is 35 years old. She is the careful mother of 3 children. Her children are not grown. 

She has a specific education and works in a medical college of her town as a teacher. Nargisa always tries to improve her knowledge and that’s why two years ago she applied to the university to receive higher education. She is a student of the second course now. Nargisa learns Biology. She is very smart and studies well. 

She is borrowing through IMON and KIVA to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks KIVA lenders for help.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Menza

texts.en:
Menza is a married woman and has four school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka, 28, is a joyous mother of 2 and a dedicated wife to Daniel. Her family means the world to her. She beganfarming 6 years ago to help her husband provide.  She  has never regretted this decision. Her primary income sources are selling milk and crops.

There is in nothing in the world Milka enjoys more than feeding and milking her cows. She loves it because the two activities are interrelated in more ways than meets the eye. She seeks a loan to purchase quality feed for her cow. 

Disease causing germs and parasites are present everywhere. Like humans, animals have an immune system which is usually able to cope with these germs. And as with humans, the efficiency of the immune system will be disturbed if animals are not properly fed. 
The acquired feed will help Milka strike a balance between disease pressure (the presence of germs and parasites) and the resistance (immune system and self-healing forces) of the animal. With your loan, the farmer will influence both sides of this balance: reduce the quantity of germs by maintaining good hygiene, and strengthen the animal's ability to cope with germs through proper feeds.

The resulting good health of her animals will boost their milk productivity. Increased income generated will help her settle farm related expenses and pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture, farming, poultry, and cattle.

She is 31 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 25-year-old divorced mother of one child. She is responsible for supporting five members of her family, thus three years ago she started selling perfumes and beauty cosmetics to satisfy their needs.

Today Amani is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special release perfume and cosmetics, as she wants to renovate her shop.

Amani hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy special perfumes and cosmetics and renovate her shop.

loans.name: Nhàn

texts.en:
Nhàn has grown food for 10 years.

Nhàn is a 44-year-old  married woman with 3 children and lives with 1 dependent,  in the  Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

She does not have a latrine and requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a  toilet and bathroom.

 Nhàn hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement,  brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Bình is 52 years old and she is married with three children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Bình faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Điền

texts.en:
Điền is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children.
She lives  in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Điền has grown food for 10 years.

She does not have a hygeinic latrine and requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.  This is Điền first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Điền hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and  her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền has grown food for 10 years and requests a loan to build a hygienic latrine.  She requests a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.  
This is Hiền first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hiền is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives with 2 dependents in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, her business to do well, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Thế

texts.en:
Mr. Thế, 39 years old, has been working in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, for more than 10 years. He is married and has 3 children. Thế lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Thế's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thế's main hardship in life is not having a biogas system. He is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build the system. With his business profit, Thế hopes for his children to do well in school, for his business to do well and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Nhóm 06-Sơn Lâm-Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyên, 39 years old, has been working in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale.

Duyên is married and has 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Duyên is the group leader of the Nhóm 06-Sơn Lâm-Quảng Thạch solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. In 2013, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Duyên has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale

loans.name: Nhom 57 Da Phan Group

texts.en:
Nhất is 39 years old and she is married with 3 children. Nhất is the group leader of the Nhom 57 Da Phan solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2012, Nhất joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhất has successfully repaid 3 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mrs. Nhất has a service separating rice from its cover. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to separate the rice from its cover. Nhất has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main harship that Nhất faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhất hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to separate rice from its cover

loans.name: Darkul

texts.ru: Даркул погасила свой предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Даркул входит в группу "Алмалуу", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека, в итоге их трое. У Даркул двое детей, она по-прежнему занимается сельским хозяйством. У Даркул есть 20 коров, 4 лошади и 70 ящиков пчелосемей. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Даркул вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса Даркул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Darkul successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Darkul is part of the "Almaluu" group that besides her consists of two more people, with three of them all together. Darkul has two children, and she is still involved in agriculture. Darkul has 20 cows, 4 horses and 70 bee hive boxes. She grows corn on 1.0 hectare of land. In order to further develop her business, Darkul requested another loan in the amount of 95,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy lambs to increase her livestock headcount. Darkul will invest the earnings from the business into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy lambs in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rented house that has electricity and piped water.

Esther has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at a market where passersby and town dwellers shop. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and weaves for sale in her salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair braids, and weaves for sale in her salon business

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre humilde y trabajador que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas como empanadas, papas rellenas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Jose y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Jose desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mesa de trabajo, un molino eléctrico, una vitrina, e ingredientes como papa, plátano, maíz, aceite, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a humble hard-working man who has dedicated a good part of his life to caring for his children. He lives in the municipality of Sincelejo from which he works spectacularly in the kitchen, since his business consists of preparing foods such as meat pies, stuffed potatoes, and other items.

He sells his foods principally to neighbors from the sector who know the flavor of Jose's foods and know they can always obtain delicious items that are very well prepared. 

Jose wishes to increase his sales of prepared foods and he wants to work in a more comfortable manner. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase a work table, an electric meat grinder, a glass display case, and ingredients such as potatoes, plantains, corn, and cooking oil, among other inputs.

The loan will allow him to advance his business and thus obtain the income necessary to sustain his family.

loans.use: buy a work table, an electric meat grinder, a glass display case, and ingredients such as potatoes, plantains, corn, and cooking oil, among other inputs.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en: Hakima was born in 1972. She is very kind woman. Hakima is a mother of two children. She is married and her husband is a worker. Hakima works in a café as a waitress. She's been working there for more than four years. She is a very hardworking woman and does her job well. Hakima’s colleagues know her as an industrious woman who is always ready to help everybody.  She lives in a house which has bad living conditions. Hakima’s bathroom is especially in a bad condition. She is going to repair her bathroom.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy Ariston and tile. This loan will help her to improve her living condition and to live happy with her family. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy Ariston and tile for the bathroom.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Minh Thịnh Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thịnh has a manufacturing business making iron and aluminum furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more iron, aluminum and glass to make furniture for sale.

Thịnh is 43 years old and she is married with three children.
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the Nhóm 02 Minh Thịnh Minh Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2012, Thịnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thịnh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thịnh has been involved in this business for three years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thịnh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more iron, aluminum and glass to make furniture to sale.

loans.name: Lệ

texts.en:
Lệ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

 Lệ is 29 years old and she is married with two children.
 Lệ lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Lệ has been involved in this business for four years.
The main hardship that Lệ faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lệ hopes to maintain a successful business and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Belma Tita

texts.en: Belma Tita is a 61-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has six adult children and relies on her food vending business and sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living. She usually cooks dishes, such as fried fish, noodles and sauteed vegetables, at home to sell in the neighborhood. Belma Tita is asking for a loan to buy rice, condiments, canned goods, chips, candies, soap, seasoning, shampoo, milk, cooking oil, vegetables and noodles. The more items on display, the more customers will be attracted with the help of the loan, thus increasing her sales and profit. In the future, Belma Tita hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments, canned goods, chips, candies, soap, seasoning,  shampoo, milk, cooking oil, vegetables and noodles

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is a  38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Charita makes a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells different kinds of goods to the people in her area. Her business is a good source of income. 

Charita wants to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and condiments. This will allow her to improve her store's inventory which will attract more buyers. 

Charita wants to become more successful in her business. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like food, soda and beverages, and soap and toiletries

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a brilliant, hardworking 47 year old Kenyan lady whose home is on a small farmland in Kutus. She gets a lot of help and support running the business from her 49 year old husband, Simon, and their two children Josephine and Paul. 

In a bid to expand her farm, Alice is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to purchase farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed. Currently, she sells crops at Kutus Town. To boost the quantity of produce she sells, she needs a loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She also needs to purchase tools and implements that will be used to work on the increased acreage.

Alice also grows fodder for her cattle. With the loan, she will buy a wider range of feed from those available in the locality. 
Alice will use any money made from this investment to help her husband meet the family's basic needs. She will also save for future investments into the business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed.

loans.name: 032003050001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mạnh has a retail business selling medicine. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

Mạnh is 54 years old and she is married with one child.
Mạnh is the group leader of the 032003050001 Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Mạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mạnh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Mạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mạnh hopes for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell.

loans.name: Tulganoy

texts.en:
Tulganoy is a young woman aged 31. She has four children. Her husband works as a master of home renovation. Her elder children are in school. Tulganoy lives in Jilikul district with her family and her husband's parents.

Tulganoy is an experienced cattle breeder. For 11 years she has been involved in animal husbandry. At present, Tulganoy intends to increase the number of cattle in her barnyard. With these intentions, she applied for a loan. In this way she wants to increase the profitability of her business.

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has been selling fish in the villages to make a living. She has been doing this with her husband for over six years, earning well for the family needs and business expansion. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for repairing her boat used for fishing. She took a new loan recently to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing activities. She plans to buy another unit of fishing boat for business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to repair the existing boat and purchase a new fishing net.

loans.name: Nhóm 2 T.tân Luật X.công Chính Group

texts.en:
Thương has a service business cutting hair. She is applying for a loan to purchase equipment to maintain her hair salon. 

Thương is 28 years old and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the nhóm 2 T.tân Luật X.công Chính  solidarity group. 

In 2013, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to maintain her hair salon.

loans.name: Aniza

texts.en: Aniza, 40 years old, is married and has 5 children. She previously often helped her husband peddle fish in their village but now has a retail business to earn additional income. Aniza has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional grocery goods for her store. She hopes to expand her business and build a bigger shelter for her convenience store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her store

loans.name: Zuwa

texts.en:
Zuwa is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rafael Julio

texts.es:
El señor Rafael es un hombre emprendedor y aplicado, desde hace 14 años comenzó con un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el municipio de Sincelejo que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

El trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 5:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de piñas y mandarinas para vender de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Rafael is a self-motivated and hardworking man. Fourteen years ago he started a business selling fruits and vegetables in the municipality of Sincelejo that so far has turned out very well for him. He works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm serving a moderately high number of customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of pineapples and tangerines to sell. This will satisfy the wishes of his customers who are asking him for these products. The support will allow him to introduce more variety to his business and provide him with a lucrative opportunity to improve his sales and his family income.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of pineapples and tangerines to sell.

loans.name: Michel Anthony

texts.es:
Michel es un joven soltero y muy trabajador, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante por ello trabaja brindando servicios de transporte con una mototaxi que tiene en su ciudad natal, Aguaytia. Por falta de recursos económicos y la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar una profesión, pero a pesar de ello él está saliendo adelante porque quiere brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia quienes son lo más importante en su vida.
Michel tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder hacer mejoras en su vivienda como pintarrajear y reforzar las paredes, así como cambiar la cerradura de la puerta. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia estará más segura y cómoda y así continuará luchando por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Michel is a single youth who is very hardworking and has a strong desire to get ahead.  He works by providing transportation services with a moto-taxi that he has in his native city of Aguatia.  Due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, he was not able to study for a profession.  However, in spite of this he is getting ahead, because he wants to provide his family with a better future.  His family is the most important thing in his life.

Michel really wants to improve his family's quality of life.  To do this, he is planning on using a loan to make improvements to his house, such as plastering and reinforcing the walls and changing the lock on the door.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that with this work his family will be more secure and comfortable, and that he is going to continue to work for their well-being.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his house

loans.name: Kulbarchin

texts.ru: Кулбарчин 45 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Кулбарчин - средне-специальное образование, работает в интернате уборщицей. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кулбарчин, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова, 10 овец, 1 лошадь а также земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где она выращивает картофель для реализации.  Ежемесячный доход Кулбарчин составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития и расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, Кулбарчин будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Kulbarchin is 45 years old, married, and has an adult son. Kulbarchin has a secondary-specialized education and works as a janitor at a boarding school. To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Kulbarchin's hard work, today her business contains 1 cow, 10 sheep, 1 horse, and 2.0 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes for sale. Kulbarchin's monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop and expand her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 20 sheep for fattening up and sale. Kulbarchin will direct the earnings from the business toward its continued development.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 35-year-old married mother of two. She works hard as a hairdresser from her house and in preparing and selling special delicious sweets upon request, since 2008. Hayat is responsible for providing for her beloved children, her husband, whom she supports with her additional income, and two other family members.

Hayat is a hardworking woman, with an excellent reputation in her domain. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her daughter's medication expenses and for doing necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place.

This is Hayat's second loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan was invested in developing her business, and she proved to be a good standing borrower. Hayat hopes that, in the future, she can develop and manage both businesses well to make sure she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medications and to do necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Stanly Agustin

texts.es:
Stanly de 26 años de edad, estudio técnico en ingeniería civil y construcción, es empleado, esta casado, padre de un hijo,  su esposa estudio hasta noveno grado.

Stanly lleva dos años trabajando como empleado, se dedica a mediciones de terreno la distancia desde su hogar a su lugar de trabajo esta a unos diez kilómetros, distancia que recorre en motocicleta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un vehículo, con lo cual espera mejorar su empleo ya que el vehículo le servirá para desempeñar mejor su trabajo.

El sueño de Stanly es mejorar sus ingresos, sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle una vida digna.
texts.en:
Stanly, 26, studied civil engineering and construction, and he's employed.  He's married and the father of one child.  His wife studied up to ninth grade.

Stanly has been working as an employee for two years.  He earns a living doing field measurements.  His job is approximately 10 kilometers from his home; he gets to work on a motorcycle.

The loan he's requesting is to buy a vehicle.  He hopes to improve his job with it, because it will help him better carry out his job.

Stanly's dream is to improve his income, get his family ahead, and give them a decent life.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to help him better carry out his job

loans.name: Iniega

texts.en: Iniega, 62 years old, is married and has two children. She resides in Lopez Jaena with her family. For more than 15 years, Iniega has peddled fresh fish in the local community. Her business has sustained and provided for her children's better living. Iniega has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fish to sell. She is now taking out a new loan to buy fishing nets. She is hopeful to earn more income and be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a 63-year-old married man, living in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines with his family. He sells fresh fish in the local community, in addition to his retail store, to make a living. For over 15 years, it has enabled him to provide for his family and make home improvements. He   successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for buying goods to sell in his retail store. He is now asking for a new loan to buy new fishing nets for his fishing activity. He is hoping to earn more income and to be able to operate his business safely.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets used for his fishing activity.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 7 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Clara esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Clara is 41 years old and lives in a home of his own with her husband and three children.  She has been making clothing for seven years from the workshop she has set up in her home.  She has many customers because of the quality of the clothing she makes.  Clara is asking for a loan to buy thread, needles, fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc. so she can continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Tanya Karina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Tanya, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos uno mayor y otro de 11 años que estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo trabaja para el Estado.
Doña Tanya es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para darles a su familia lo mejor, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, ella también en su local y puerta a puerta vende ropa, zapatos, bisuterías, perfumes entre otros productos, sus hijos y su marido le ayudan en su local cuando ella tiene que salir a vender sus productos, lleva más de 20  años dedica al comercio el cual le encanta ya que además de ganarse algo por su cuenta esta atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda, ropa y zapatos. Lleva 12 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy  necesarios para ella. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes Loan Group meet every 2 weeks in the Montecristi district, well-known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts which are recognised at both a national and international level. It's famous for its straw hats. 

This is where 41-year-old Tanya lives. She is married and her and her husband have 2 children, one who is grown-up and studies at university and the other who is 11 and studies at school. Her husband works for the state. 

Tanya is a very hardworking woman who likes working in order to provide her family with the best. She runs a grocery store from her home, where she sells a variety of basic goods. She also sells clothes, shoes, jewellery, perfumes and other products in her store as well as door-to-door. Her children and husband help her in her store when she has to go out to sell products. She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years and she loves it because not only does she earn something for herself, she can also meet her sons' needs. 

She will use this loan to buy food, clothes and shoes to stock her store. She has been in the loan group for 12 years and she likes it because the loans are very much a necessity for her. Her dream is to keep moving forward every day.

loans.use: to buy food, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello world. Meet an industrious Kenyan woman from a Kuserwo location, who goes by the name of Mercy. This year, Mercy celebrated her first firstborn son's birthday with her husband, Geoffrey. 

The lovely couple owns a small-fenced farmland in the acclivitous Cherengany hills. On the farm, they mostly rear livestock. As her family grows bigger, Mercy is constantly looking for more ways to grow her income. 

The business plan that she is currently working on is venturing into poultry farming. The market for poultry products is there, the space on the farm is sufficient, and the two have been farming long enough to be able to raise chickens. What is missing is the capital to get started. 

Mercy is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase a brood of hens to start poultry farming. This venture will enable her, not only to increase her income, but also to manage certain business risks, through product diversification. 

Income from this investment will generate enough income for the couple to settle their family's basic needs, such as food.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Johana, or better known as "Johnny,” who is an energetic, brave, and humble man who hails from the Molo area of Kenya - an area that is very fertile and always receives plenty of rainfall. The major cash crop grown in the Molo area is potatoes, and that is why this region is nicknamed “potatoes region”. 

Johana is a caring father and has been farming for the past 10 years. Through farming, he has been able to take care of his children and family. Johana also does business so that he can make ends meet and increase his profit levels. Through these ventures, he has always brought food back home and earned an honest living. He is a very hardworking man, and sells milk and his produce in the market and also to his neighbors so that he is able to make more money. 

One challenge that he is currently facing involves getting his products to the market on time. Because of the poor road network and poor feeder roads, the products are no longer fresh when they reach the market. This means that Johana must sell them at a throw-away price, hence not getting maximum profit. Products such as milk, fruits, and vegetables require a timely delivery to market and, for this reason, Johana is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to buy a motorbike that will assist him in getting his products to market faster. 

He is sure of reaping more profit because his products will be fresh and will fetch more money. With improved profits, Johana will be able to assure his children of a brighter future and also improve his living conditions. Having gone through and understood the repayment schedule, he is sure that he will be able to repay the loan on time and increase his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so that he can get his produce to market faster.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman who has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Irene has operated a poultry selling business for over 5 years. She mentioned disease outbreak, causing losses, as a challenge in the business. Irene dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

Irene wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Maria Hildanely

texts.es:
La venta de alimentos es la profesión que mantiene activa económicamente a la señora maría quien por su ya avanzada edad de 57 años le es casi imposible lograr emplearse en una empresa, pero gracias a su buena mano para la cocina tiene su negocio donde vende comidas típicas, fiambres, y refrigerios. 
Gracias a este negocio maría puede mantenerse pues es su único apoyo económico y ahora se ve en apuros y es que necesita de mucha urgencia una estufa para cocer sus alimentos e insumos para trabajar. 
Quiere solicitar un crédito para cubrir esta grave falencia ya que sin la estufa no puede laborar y los insumos serán un gran impulso para elaborar mas productos y tener una mejor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Selling food is how this woman earns a living.  Maria is 57 years old and it’s almost impossible for her to find a job at a company, but thanks to her good hand in the kitchen, she has a business where she sells typical foods meets and cold cuts.

Thanks to this business she is able to support herself, but this is her only means of financial support.  Now she is concerned because she really needs a stove to prepare her food, and supplies with which to work.

She is asking for a loan to cover this important need because without the stove she is not able to work and the supplies will be a great boost in making more products and having better profits.

loans.use: to buy a stove and ingredients.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmar es un joven de 19 años de edad que vive en el sector de turbo, una zona muy afectada por la violencia, el desempleo, la falta de oportunidades y la pobreza, en este sector la educación casi no se ve pero hay jóvenes promesas que quieren cambiar el rumbo de la historia de este importante puerto para Colombia. 
Uno de ellos es Wilmar quien con su venta de plátano ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar, asistiéndolos con capital para poder comer y tener una vida casi digna pues las extremas condiciones de pobreza de estas personas son alarmantes y son las que más necesitan apoyo, como el que solicita Wilmar para tener capital de trabajo para comprar y distribuir plátano a los diferentes proveedores que vienen de otras ciudades.
Su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y poder estudiar para tener un futuro más prometedor.
texts.en:
Wilmal is a 19 year old young man who lives in the Turb area, one that has been greatly affected by the violence, unemployment, lack of opportunity, and poverty.  Education is rarely seen here, but there are young people here who want to change the trend of this important Colombian port.

Wilmar is among them and through his plantain sales has been able to supply the household with money for food and to have a nearly dignified life because the poverty these people live under is alarming and they need support like the kind Wilber is asking for.  He will use the money to buy and distribute plantains to the suppliers in other cities.

His dream is to improve his and his family’s living conditions and get an education so he can have a more promising future.

loans.use: to buy plantains.

loans.name: Besim

texts.en:
Besim is 33 years old and the father of 3 children. He comes from the Ashakli community and, as the main source of income for his family, works hard to offer his children a better life. He works as both a cleaner and doing freelance painting for homes and businesses, often working from very early in the morning until late at night. 

He is requesting a loan for the first time in order to renovate his very old and run down house. This loan will help his family to have better living conditions and improved standards. His goal is to offer his children a better education and future. 

He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate his very old and run-down house.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program, and this is his story:
“Some people consider a computer as a difficult thing to use or to repair. For me, it’s so simple. For example, if you need to do something with computer, you can learn about it on Google or on You Tube and repeat it. I used to repair computers, phones, and smartphones from school and know some programs like ASSEMBLER, Basic, etc. Later I felt that programming is more interesting than just repairing computers and that’s why I chose the Software Engineering Department.
With admission to the AUCA I learnt other interesting programming languages such as C#, Basic, Python. Furthermore my dream is not just to be a professional programmer and to start my own software development business, but also to create a programming language, an easy one to learn and use.
As someone who spent a year studying at another university and was disappointed with quality of teaching and approach to learning as a whole, I can state with confidence that AUCA is the right and best place to fulfill my dreams: to be a good programmer like my father and make inventions in Software.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 33 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old. In order to earn a living, he is working as a waiter in a restaurant in his community while his wife stays home taking care of the children and the house. He has to work many long hours but is satisfied with his salary. He also receives tips, as it is a very expensive restaurant. 

He is now requesting a loan in order to paint his house and complete some renovations. This loan will help him to have better living conditions.

He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to paint his house and complete some renovations.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married father of one child. Due to increasing living costs, Ali opened new source of income to cover his family's needs and expenses. He owns a grocery shop and a generator for an electricity connection business.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan to expand his grocery shop and increase his business merchandise with more newly-requested products to satisfy his customers' needs. Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with more newly-requested products

loans.name: Beronica Palmira

texts.es: Beronica de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijol y naranjas, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Beronica está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Beronica is 41 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two children.  She has been raising corn, beans, and oranges for 10 years and sells her products in surrounding villages since she has steady customers.  Beronica is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insecticides, etc. so she can improve the land shown in the image.  This will allow her to continue raising her crops which are her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 T.thái Sơn 1 X.công Chính Group

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby chicks to raise for future sale. 

Hương is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3 member group, the Nhóm 3 T.thái Sơn 1 X.công Chính solidarity group. 

In 2013, Hương joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby chicks to raise for future sale

loans.name: Saloma

texts.en:
Saloma is a widow who lives with her family in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is her family's sole provider.

To earn a living, she sells fish in the market and in her community. She has been earning income to sustain and improve her business. She recently took a loan to buy new fishing nets.
