Her previous loan for the business has been repaid successfully. She hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Njei

texts.en:
Njei is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Njei has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Njei wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer is a farmer from Miasnikyan village in the Armavir region. She lives with her nice and big family. Varditer is the mother of two sons; her elder son is married with two children.

The family's main worker is Varditer's elder son Henzel, who is a teacher at local school. The other family members are occupied in agriculture. They run a farm which includes livestock like cows, calves, sheep, and hens. They also cultivate cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplants, and grass. Every member in the family has his own task in the farming business: Varditer and her daughter-in-law take care of the farm and livestock, and her husband and son sell the gathered harvest locally.

Varditer, with a good credit history behind her, has applied for this loan to purchase 4 oxen for her livestock. The loan will be a big support for this family to enlarge their farming business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy 4 oxen to increase the number of livestock on the farm.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which he used for buying working tools and raw materials for his welding business. 

For the last 30 years, he has earned his living by working with metals. He has his own workshop and is very well-known and popular in the area, with a large customer base and good reputation. He is very happy and satisfied with his career and is happy that he it provides enough for his family, as he is the main source of income. 

At this time, he needs a second loan in order to renovate the frame of his workshop. He hopes in the future to be able to expand his business even more and hire an employee to help him keep up with his customer orders. 

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate the frame for the workshop of his welding business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 61-year-old widow from Leyte, Philippines. For more than 4 years, she has earned a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store business, selling various goods to the people in her area. 

Elsa is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as rice, bananas, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries to sell. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, which will attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Elsa hopes to make her business productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, bananas, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora was born in 1961. She is widowed with a son, and lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. She makes embroidery in clothes, mainly national women clothes.

Gulnora is very hardworking woman who enjoys her job. Her business is the main source of family income. Currently her son is a migrant in Russia.

Gulnora wants to build a new house for her family but does not have money to finish it. She is asking for a loan of TJS 7500 to pay builder's fees. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay builder's fees

loans.name: Valiyakhon

texts.en:
Valiyakhon was born in 1971 in Tajikistan. She is an example of a national Tajik woman. She is a very industrious and ambitious woman.

Valiyakhon has 4 children. Their ages are 23, 22, 19, and 10. She is a very careful mother. Valiyakhon’s husband is a migrant in Russia. He is a builder there.

Valiyakhon had worked on a collective farm before organizing her business. For the last 3 years she has been busy with buying and selling children's clothes in a local market. She has a store where she sells different kinds of children's clothing. She renews the assortment of goods periodically.

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni because she must buy wood and coal to keep her house warm in the winter season. In Tajikistan there is a deficiency of electricity in the winter season, so Valiyakhon needs your support. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 28 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. He hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. 

Michael has a wife and two children that he really admires and would do anything for so that they never lack anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, he has always been able to provide food for his family and also meet their basic needs. He has acquired much experience over the last ten years, and this has helped him earn profits. 

He is seeking a loan for KES 20,000 to buy poultry and, through the loan, he is sure that he will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Chuka, which is densely populated and has a ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Michael has, and also because of the good will he enjoys with the villagers, he will not have any challenge in selling his products. He also believes that through word of mouth he will be able to get more customers and increase his customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Michael and his family, and this will also allow him to make permanent changes to his life and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in the village Getahovit in the Tavush region. She is married and she has big family; she lives with her husband, two children (a daughter who is a student and a school-aged son) and her parents-in-law. Alvard has no higher education, only a vocational one. For many years she worked at the carpet factory as a carpet weaver. 

Now Alvard works at the bread factory as a baker and, at the same time with her husband, they are busy with farming and agriculture. For many years they have gathered a perfect harvest of fruits from their orchard - apples, persimmons, plums, and figs - which Alvard sells through the re-sellers. The main source of income Alvard’s family has is from poultry, since Alvard has many regular customers to whom she sells chicken meat and eggs. In her farm she has 40 chickens and the quantity of eggs is great enough both for sale and for her family use.

Alvard will be very thankful if the Kiva lenders be so kind to give her this loan, which she will use for organizing autumn sowing activities and also to do some repair work in her orchard.

loans.use: to organize autumn sowing activities and also to do some repair work in her orchard.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Nuriddin is 55 years old. He is a business man. Nuriddin has been busy with buying and selling food products. He has a food shop, which is located near his living house. Nuriddin has run this business for 10 years. His wife helps him with managing the business. 

Nuriddin and his wife try to offer good education for their two children. Now, their daughter studies in Russia at the Medical University. She studies at the faculty of Medicine. Nuriddin must pay for her daughter’s education at the university, and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 2200 USD. 

He is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education in medical school.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has been selling fish in their villages to make a living. She has been doing this with her husband for over eight years, earning well for family needs and business expansion. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for activities. 

She took a new loan recently to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing activities. She plans to buy another fishing boat for business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing.

loans.name: Mane

texts.en:
We are happy to introduce you our already second-stage of borrower (both for Kiva and Nor Horizon) whose name is Mane. She lives in Vanadzor city, which is in Lori region, with her school-aged children and parents-in law. Her husband is in the Russian Federation for a work abroad. 

Mane has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, in the faculty of Methodology of Elementary Schools and already 10 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. At the same time, at her house she gives individual paid courses of Armenian Language and Literature to a group of pupils, preparing them for the entrance examinations. 

Mane asked for her first Kiva loan in order to buy a computer and very necessary methodological literature, which she uses every day. This time Mane asks for this Kiva loan since she wants to take part in training courses of Teaching Methodologies in Yerevan city, which are paid. But it is so important for her that she just cannot miss it. The other part of the loan amount she will furnish the room where she teaches her individual courses.

loans.use: to pay for training courses and also to furnish the room where she teaches her individual courses.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Dalarik village with her husband, 17-year old daughter, and one-year old son. She and her husband are farmers. Their livestock includes four mother pigs, 19 piglets, and hens. 

Anzhela also grows wheat and grass. Last season, Anzhela grew tomato, cucumber, and watermelon, and was able to sell them successfully. This season she plans to grow wheat. 

Anzhela has applied for this loan to purchase wheat seeds and forage for the livestock. She will be very grateful to lenders who help her collect the needed amount of money and support her farming business.

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock and wheat seed.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира  трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 44 года она замужем , имеет троих прекрасных детей, которым хочет дать хорошее образование и достойные условия для проживания. Для этой цели она с мужем трудится не покладая рук. Она оказывает населению услуги по пошиву национальных платьев. Свою работу старается выполнять качественно, чтобы удовлетворить потребности своих клиентов и  привлечь еще и новых клиентов. Она очень хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для того чтобы купить ткани и другие необходимые материалы для пошива одежды ей необходимо дополнительная сумма. Для этой цели она хочет взять кредит в "Арванде". Мунира очень надеется ,что "Арванд" поможет ей воплотить планы в реальность и улучшить благосостояние большой семьи.
texts.en: Munira is hardworking woman. She is 44 years old, married and has three beautiful children, whom she wants to provide a good education and decent living conditions. She and her husband work very hard to achieve this goal. She provides residents with national dresses sewing services. She tries to do quality work to satisfy her clients' needs and attract more new clients. She really wants to expand her business. She needs additional money to buy fabrics and other necessary materials for sewing clothes. To achieve this goal, she wants to obtain a loan from "Arvand." Munira really hopes that "Arvand" will help her realize her plans and improve the welfare of her large family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other necessary materials for sewing clothes

loans.name: Imri

texts.en:
Imri is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years old. He is involved in agricultural work, raising and keeping 2 cows to sell the milk and milk products in his area. 

Imri has much demand from his customers for his products and does not have enough supply to satisfy it all. He is very well-known for his organic products that people are very interested in. He is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase another dairy cow. 

In the future, he plans to increase the number of cows and thereby increase his profits. He is very satisfied and pleased with this work and the profit he receives from it and hopes that he will be able to continue his business. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Armavir town with her husband and 21-year-old son. 

The family is occupied in agricultural work. The farm that they own includes livestock of three cows and 11 turkeys. Near the house where they live, Ruzanna also keeps an orchard where 350 cherry trees are grown. Ruzanna takes care of her farm with great care, love, and pleasure and realizes that it is a very important source for the family's income. 

By applying for this loan of USD 2,000, Ruzanna asks lenders to support her in purchasing two oxen, renovating the barn and roof, as well as purchasing forage for feeding the livestock during the winter. This investment is very important for Ruzanna and her family to enlarge their farm and be prepared for the winter season.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, renovating the barn, and forage for the livestock during the winter

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 43 years old, married, and he has 3 kids. He has been working on a water team project for 15 years and has good experience in this area. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

Ahmad knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them and how to keep them in control. Additionally he takes part in the building of such channels. Now their team is building a new irrigation canal for all neighbor regions in order to improve living conditions and fruit, vegetable, and crop fields’ productivity.

His income doesn’t cover the family’s living costs. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy new, quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team. This will increase the quality of his team’s work and their income.

loans.use: to buy new, quality tools

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old married father of six. He is a Syrian citizen who is living in a Palestinian camp with his beloved family because he can't afford to cover the expenses of living outside.

Mohamad started his own mobile phone shop in 2012. He is working hard to develop it as much as he can to make sure that he can remain capable of covering his family's increasing needs, since he is financially responsible for eight family members.

Mohamad's acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in increasing his business merchandise with newly-released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards. In addition, he will invest part of this loan in supporting his parents' living.

In the future, he plans to buy his existing shop in order to save rental fees, or to open another branch in a very good location.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly-released mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Madona Group

texts.en:
Rutchel is the featured borrower of Madona group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines. 

Rutchel is a 36-year-old married mother of one child. She left her family in the Philippines and traveled to Lebanon to work in order to improve her family's living conditions, so she started cooking and selling food from her house. Today, Rutchel is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business by buying more foodstuffs, which will help her cook different kinds of food and satisfy her customers' needs.

With respect to the other group members, Maricar is the first lady on the left, Rizza is the second lady on the left, Jenelyn is the first lady on the right, while Rutchel is the second lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Ocha

texts.en:
Ocha is a kind woman. She was born in 1953 and is the caring mother of eight children. She works hard to earn a living and to offer good living conditions to her children. Ocha has been busy buying and selling sewing machines for more than 12 years. She sells sewing machines in a local market where she has a store. Ocha paid the wedding expenses of six of her children from the profits of her business. 

Ocha’s elder son studies at the Medical University of Tajikistan. Ocha must pay for her son’s tuition at the university and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 1,050 USD. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education in medical school

loans.name: Bahram

texts.en:
Bahram is 23 years old and lives with his parents and brother. He has been working in a water project company for three years and participates in the building and cleaning of irrigational channels. His monthly income is 200 AZN, which doesn’t cover his family’s demands. 

Channels are artificial bodies of water erected for directing and controlling the flow of water. Many companies build irrigational channels. These channels are used for artificial injection of water into the soil. Additionally, as the soil experiences persistent or recurrent lack of moisture, these channels enable it to obtain stable and high crop yields.

Bahram is very interested in this area and wants to expand his business. He wants to make this work more profitable and of higher quality. He applied for 1000 AZN in order to buy new irrigational tools for artificial irrigation.

loans.use: to buy new irrigational tools for artificial irrigation.

loans.name: John Michael

texts.en:
John Michael owns and operates a transportation service, which he has been doing for over four years. He supports the family's daily needs with this income.   

John Michael's previous loan was used for repairing his vehicle. He requested another loan, which he will use to buy another vehicle for transportation services. He wants to renovate his house for a safer and more comfortable living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase another vehicle for transportation services

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda was born in 1977. She is married and has five children. She has a big and friendly family. She loves her children very much and tries to offer high-quality living conditions for them. Her husband works in a laboratory. Umeda is a higher-educated woman. She works in a school as a teacher, teaching Russian language. She has great experience and her pupils like her classes very much. 

Umeda’s daughter is a student. She must pay for her tuition and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 800 USD. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Leidi Yaneth

texts.es:
Leidi es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de 8 años al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 1 año se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina botonadora esto le permitirá aumentar su volumen de producción para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales.

Leidi manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leidi is a strong, helpful and hard-working woman. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of an 8 year old son who she is raising with great effort and dedication.

For the last year, she has been working in dressmaking, providing  a tailoring service to third parties and direct customers. She learned the trade by herself and works alone every day. Through this, she makes enough money to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is now applying for this loan to buy a button-sewing machine that will allow her to increase her output and meet the delivery deadlines for her current orders, thus keeping her customers loyal.

Leidi says that she wants to continue working very hard because she wants to expand her business and be able to create employment opportunities, as well as ensuring economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a button-sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Irma is the featured borrower of the Love Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippine to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back home.

Irma is a 61-year-old widowed mother of four children who traveled to Lebanon and started working as a housemaid to cover the needs and expenses of her family. Today, Irma is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send to her family in the Philippines for necessities.

Irma is the lady standing in the middle. Sally is standing on the right, and Carmela is the lady standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to send to her family in the Philippines

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is married and has two children, who are 6 and 4 years old. She has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life, so she decided to start a new business buying and selling dried fruits in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. Her husband is a teacher in a local school. Dilafruz took a course, "To Get Ahead," at a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her husband will help her with the business. She will sell dried fruits in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy dried fruits to start her new business. She will get through using this loan, and her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to start her new business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is 29 years old and divorced. Six months ago, she started her sewing business using an old sewing machine belonging to her mother. Zuhro no longer wants to be a burden to her parents so she engaged in this activity in order to earn a living and to help her parents in supporting the family.

Zuhro requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a new sewing machine. This loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nanzala

texts.en:
Nanzala is single and operates a tailoring business, which she has been doing for four years. She makes women's and men's suits.
 
Nanzala requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: William Joan

texts.es:
William es un hombre de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.

El tiene un pequeño negocio en el que prepara y vende frituras como papas fritas y chicharrones.

Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes.

El desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de papas, aceite, maíz, entre otros para sus preparaciones.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda y buen corazón de las personas para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
William is a man of experience, wisdom, and patience.

He has a small business where he prepares and sells fried foods like french fries and chicharrones.

He works every day for 10 hours so he can have his food fresh and ready for his customers.

He wants to invest in his business and to get an advance on supplies and inventory, but to do this he needs a loan so he can purchase potatoes, oil, corn and other products he needs for food preparation.

One of his biggest challenges is his lack of money to invest in his business but he is confident that with the help of good-hearted people he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: purchase inventory like potatoes, oil, corn and more.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He is a very enterprising man. He constantly struggles to raise his children. For more than five years, he has worked as a taxi driver. His honesty, responsibility, and punctuality have been the reasons for his job promotion, and he believes he is doing well because he always does his best. 

Bahodur requested a loan for $1,500, which he will use to make improvements to his house, such as changing doors and windows to plastic doors and windows. In this way, he and his family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase plastic doors and windows

loans.name: Alba Cristina

texts.es:
Ella es Alba, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 3 meses en un pequeño carro de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en muchos restaurantes en meses pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas como trabajos de pintura, reforma, montaje de lavaplatos, comprar insumos para sus preparaciones y de este modo poder instalarse en un local.

 Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Her name is Alba, and she is a woman of good character. She wants to see her business grow, enabling her to get ahead in life along with her husband and two children.

She decided to open a business preparing and selling fast food and drinks. She opened for business about 3 months ago with a small stand and some food but with a will to succeed and to push on. She learned about how to run her business by working in many different restaurants in previous months and this has allowed her to gain a lot of experience.

Today she wants to give her business a little boost and so she is applying for a loan in order to improve her stand through new paint, repairs, a dishwasher and to also purchase supplies she needs to prepare her food. This will help her install her business in a more permanent location.

She is a woman who has overcome obstacles and faces challenges bravely.

loans.use: to improve her business's appearance and functionality.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 43 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, five currently in school. For the past five years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her motor garage, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for the business, and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standard of living. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shamim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for the business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy six quintals of fertilizer, 700 banana tree stumps and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Friendship2 Group

texts.en:
Elena is the featured borrower of Friendship2 Group. She is 64 years old, married, and has four children. Due to the low financial situation of her family in the Philippines, she traveled to Lebanon to work in a clothes and accessories shop to improve her family's living conditions.

Elena requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable winter clothes and accessories. This loan will help her increase her income and attract more customers. She and the other group members have always been friends since they left their the Philippines to come to work in Lebanon with a better income to support their families in the Philippines.

Elena is the first person on the right, Agustina is the person standing in the middle, and Mayrose is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fashionable winter clothes and accessories

loans.name: Zulbiyo

texts.en:
Zulbiyo is a kind woman, widowed and the mother of a child who is 17 years old. 
She has been sewing women's clothes for five years. Thanks to her experience in this field and her influence over her clients, she is able to obtain goods for sewing but it brings in little income. It does not allow her to provide for the needs of her family and build a new house, which her family needs. This year, she is going to build new house with modern planning. Her new house will have two bedrooms, a large living-room, veranda and kitchen. Her son wants to marry a lovely girl and they will live in the new house. She is asking for a loan of  $1,000 (USD) to buy building materials such as cement and wood for building a new house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood to build a new house.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill her family's demands, including food, health care, clothing, and education. She and her husband sell flowers and plants and earn a good amount of income to support the family. In order to purchase different types of seeds, flowers and plants, she has sought a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to improve her sales to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, flowers and plants

loans.name: Gul  Nargis

texts.en: Gul Nargis is a 31-year-old married woman who, for many years, has been selling animals with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. For the improvement of her business she has sought a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with two children, both in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Carlos al ver que su negocio estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Carlos se encuentra soltero y es padre de 1 hijo, a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Carlos ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Carlos aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de mano y una cortadora de madera.
texts.en:
Carlos has worked in carpentry for most of his life. At an early age he began working as an employee in carpenters' and cabinetmakers' workshops, where he learned the skills.

On seeing that his work was very underpaid, Carlos decided to become independent and start his own carpenter's workshop where, thanks to the high quality of his work, he gained a lot of customers.

Carlos is single and has a son. Carlos has always wanted to offer his son a better quality of life and more opportunities for advancement.

Because of difficulties with capital, Carlos has had to reject some requests from his customers because it's hard to get the necessary raw materials.

In an effort to improve this position, Carlos hopes that a loan will gives him the ability to buy hand tools and a wood cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy hand tools and a wood cutting machine

loans.name: Naeed

texts.en:
Naeed is a 42-year-old married woman who has been in the business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past 5 years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Currently she has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia, 28 years old, is a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) runs a general store. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Sadia has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Ena Maricela

texts.es:
Ena de 25 años de edad,  es soltera y tiene un hijo que ya asiste al kínder, ella estudio hasta 8° grado de educación básica, con ella vive una tía, un primo y su hijo, solo su hijo depende de ella.

Ena es comerciante, tiene 4 años de manejar una pupuseria, aprendió por iniciativa propia al no encontrar trabajo, su negocio lo tiene cerca de su casa y trabaja cerca de 6 horas diarias.El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, quesillo, chicharrón que son los principales ingredientes de su producto, lo necesita para tener de reserva.

Ena espera que con su trabajo pueda dar a su hijo la oportunidad de estudio que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ena, 25 years old, is single and has a son who is already in school. She studied until the 8th grade. Her aunt, a cousin, and her son live with her, but only her son depends on her.

Ena is a businesswoman. She has been managing a pupusa [stuffed corn tortilla] stall for 4 years. She learned by her own initiative after not being able to find work. She has her business close to her house, and she works around 6 hours a day.

The loan will be used to buy corn, local cheese, and pork rind, which are the primary ingredients for her product. She needs it in order to have a reserve.

Ena hopes that with her job, she will be able to give her son the opportunity to study that she didn't have.

loans.use: to buy corn, local cheese, and pork rind.

loans.name: Evelyn Maritza

texts.es:
Evelyn de 20 años de edad,  testa casada y tiene un hijo,  solo estudio hasta  9° grado de educación básica, su esposo es albañil, solo él y su hijo viven con ella.

Evelyn se dedica a criar ganado lechero, tiene 4 años de trabajar de esta manera, es una forma de ayudar  a su esposo con los gastos del hogar con la venta de la leche y sus derivados. Su esposo también l apoya en los tiempos libres.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos vacas lecheras, actualmente solo tiene dos y quiere mejorar el negocio de lácteos. Evelyn espera su negocio se fortalezca siendo su fuente de ingreso para dar estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 20 years old, is married, and has a son. She only studied until ninth grade of primary school. Her husband works in construction. Only he and their son live with her.

Evelyn raises dairy cows. She has worked in this field of 4 years. She helps her husband with the household expenses by selling milk and milk products. Her husband also supports her in his spare time.

The loan will be used to buy two dairy cows. At present, she only has two cows, and she wants to improve the dairy business. Evelyn hopes that her business will improve, since it is the source of income for providing an education to her son.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a humble, 56 year old man, who alongside his wife works in their small inherited piece of land as poultry and dairy farmers. This is a very common occupation around the town of Kitale where there are not many employment opportunities, and for this reason there is a lot of undertaking and competition in the dairy and poultry farming. 

For the past 10 years, he has been involved in mixed farming on his small piece of land. His major primary sources of income are egg selling, crops, and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet. He passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, his response was “feeding my poultry.” He sells eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into his compound and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, he is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan he will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used in improving his living conditions and he plans on expanding his business to other towns. Other than increased profits he will also benefit from poultry manure which will be used in his vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make his business flourish and hence provide a secure solid education system to his children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish, is a 27-year-old lady. For the past 8 years, she has been involved in running a boutique. After purchasing cloth from the market she stitches it. She has a strong customer base. 

For the improvement of her business, Mehwish has availed herself of 25,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija, a 33-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews and then sells it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Khadija has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Dúo El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
DUO EL BUEN PASTOR
Doña Martina es originaria de San Jose Poaquil, tiene 26 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad esta su hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante y su negocio a crecido poco a poco, gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que es el único medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio, ofrecer diferentes estilos de ropa a sus clientes asi tendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a su hija a la escuela para futuro mejor.Solicita el credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
The Good Shepard Pair

Martina is from San Jose Poaquil. She is 26 years old, and she is responsible for her young daughter. She sells traditional clothing and makes traditional fabric by hand.

She began with a small business, and thanks to God, little by little, she has been able to go forward. Her business has also grown little by little. Thanks to the support of her husband, she continues with her business since it is the only way she has to go forward.

Her dream is to grow her business, to offer different styles of clothing to her clients to make more earnings, and to send her daughter to school for a better future. 

She requests the loan to buy raw material to make and sell traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making and selling traditional clothing.

loans.name: Evelin Yamileth

texts.es:
Evelin de 18 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, es muy trabajador y vive con sus padres.

Evelin es ama de casa, siempre se desempeñó de esta manera, primero solo en su casa pero desde que dejo de estudiar trabajó como empleada doméstica, actualmente trabaja en una casa donde cuida a una señora de avanzada edad, procurando que no le falte nada, a veces hasta se queda a dormir  donde ella para estar mas al pendiente.

El préstamo ser utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera, de la que sus padres se harán cargo, piensa en la venta de la leche y sus derivados como una forma de apoyar a los gastos de la casa. Evelin sueña con comprar un pequeño terreno en el que construirá su casa y tendrá su propia familia.
texts.en:
Evelin is 18 years old. She is single and has no children. She completed High School. She is hard-working and she lives with her parents.

Evelin is a housewife. She has always done this. At first, just at her house, but since she stopped attending school, she has worked as a housemaid.

Currently, she is working in a house where she takes care of an old lady. She provides for everything. Sometimes, she spends the night with her, so she can look after her. 

She is going to use the loan to buy a milk cow. Her parents will take care of it. She is thinking on selling the milk and the by-products to support the family with the household expenses.

Evelin's dream is to buy a small piece of land where she'll build a house and she'll have her own family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Luz

texts.es:
José de 73 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 45, 37, 28 y 25 años de edad,  3 con hogar parte. Él estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica, su esposa se dedica los oficios domésticos, solo ella y su hija menor y dos nietos viven con él. 

José es agricultor, desde muy joven, aprendió trabajando con su padre cultivando maíz y frijol, su hija le ayuda en las labores agrícolas. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla, fertilizante y herbicidas para sembrar maíz y frijol.

José espera sacar su familia adelante, a pesar de que no tiene hijos pequeños tiene sus nietos que quiere lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Jose is 73 years old, is married, and has four children, who are 45, 37, 28, and 25 years old; three of his children have their own homes. He studied until second grade of primary school. His wife is dedicated to household tasks. Only she, their young daughter, and two grandchildren live with him.

Jose has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He learned the work with his father. He grows corn and beans. His daughter helps him in the agricultural work. 

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides to grow corn and beans.

Jose hopes to take his family forward. Even though he doesn’t have young children, he has grandchildren, and he wants the best for them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 23 y 22 años de edad y ninguno vive ya con ella. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado de educación básica, su esposo es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol; con ella vive su esposo y dos nietos.

María tiene una tienda desde hace 12 años, aprendió por iniciativa propia porque quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y sacar adelante a sus hijos. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar aceite, maíz, arroz, golosinas, sodas entre otros productos que vende y que demandan sus clientes.

María piensa ubicar su negocio en el municipio más cercano para mejorar las ventas por la afluencia de mayor cantidad de personas.
texts.en:
María, 47, is married and has four children, who are 26, 24, 23 and 22 years of age.   None live with her. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans. She lives with him and two grandchildren. She was only able to attend school until the third grade.

María has had a store for 12 years. She learned the business on her own initiative because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses and help her children get ahead.

She will use the loan to purchase cooking oil, corn, rice, sweets and sodas, among other products that she sells and that her customers demand.

María plans to locate her business in the nearest town to improve sales due to a larger number of people.

loans.use: to purchase oil, corn, rice, sweets and sodas, among other products.

loans.name: Alvaro Luis

texts.es:
Alvaro un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo. 

Dedicado en pleno al trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto, pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad. 

Como habilidoso y responsable agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para mejorar sus cultivos, pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos y comprar insumos como pesticidas y abonos para su campo.

De este modo podrá continuar con su trabajo y tendrá una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a humble farmer, who goes to work on his farm every morning. He is dedicated in full to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering a good product. He knows that many people consume his products and, because of this, every drop of sweat that comes from his forehead is the determination that he puts in so that his products are pure and of good quality. 

As a skilled and responsible farmer, he always wants to carry out repairs and improvements to improve his crops, but he knows that these repairs and implementations are very expensive. For this reason, he requests a loan to improve his fields and to buy supplies, such as pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

In this way, he will be able to continue with his work and will have a better production.

loans.use: to improve his fields and to buy supplies, such as pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity in her house.

loans.name: Cerly Ereny

texts.es:
Cerly, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo, adicionalmente vende cosméticos a través de catalogo.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos y también para compra surtido de cosméticos para su comercialización.

Ella es una mujer soñadora y gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de las personas.
texts.en:
Cerly, with her husband, has formed a very strong family and productive unit, since she not only prioritizes love, but also desires of going forward and progressing as a family.

She raises and sells pigs. This is an activity she learned from her husband, who, at present, does this work. It has been the main source of income for a long time. She also sells cosmetics by catalog. 

She requests financial help to buy some small pigs and then to care for and raise them so that she could later sell them. She will also buy a supply of cosmetics for selling.

She is a woman with dreams and with a lot of willpower, so much so that she has plans and wants to have a pigpen with a big capacity.

She has big dreams and expectations for this project, and she has confidence in people having good hearts.

loans.use: to buy some small pigs and to buy a supply of cosmetics.

loans.name: Dúo Joyas Valiosas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Joyas Valiosas
Formado por maría Filomena es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. María Filomena es propietaria de una tienda de consumo es una persona responsable y lucha por atender bien a sus clientes y ofrecerles siempre lo mejor. Ella sueña con un negocio más grande para tener así más clientes e ingresos para ayudar a su familias  a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para surtir aún más su negocio.
texts.en: Dúo Joyas Valiosas is formed by María Filoment who is originally from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. María Filomena is the owner of a grocery store. She is a responsible person wh0 strives to attend to her customers and offer them the best. She dreams of owning a bigger business so she can have more customers and income to help her family cover household expenses. She is applying for the loan to buy food products to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old, married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided two years ago to use her twenty-five years of experience to start tailoring and selling clothes on her own. In this way, she helps her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Elizabeth is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to expand her business and increase her business merchandise with new, winter season, fashionable clothes and textiles. These will help her satisfy her customers' requests.

Elizabeth hopes to open her own tailoring shop in the future, to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income even more.

loans.use: to buy winter season clothes and textiles.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married mother of one child who is still young and has not started school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transportation.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a brilliant, hardworking 46-year-old Kenyan mixed farmer from Cheptarit location in North Rift, Kenya. She started farming roughly two decades ago when she got married to Mr. Kosgei. Her husband owns five acres of land where she keeps cattle and poultry, and grows maize and trees. 

Irene is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES to purchase a water tank. A water tank is quite vital, especially for a farmer doing mixed farming in an area like Cheptarit, characterized by seasonal rainfall. On the farm, she has five cows, 10 chickens, maize, and trees that require a sufficient supply of water throughout the year. This loan investment will allow Irene to store huge volumes of water to be used sparingly during dry seasons. As a result, her animals will stay hydrated and the plants of the farm will grow green and healthy.
 
Income from this investment will enable her to raise her children better and pay for their tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of cell phone accessories to restock his business.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem, a 44-year-old lady, has three children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been selling vegetables in his locality for many years. She uses the income to support her entire family. Currently she has availed a Murabaha of 35,000 PKR for her husband; he used it to purchase more sacks of vegetables, including onions, potatoes, ginger, and garlic. He hopes the additional inventory will increase his sales to generate a healthier source of income for providing a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase  more sacks of vegetables

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is 25 years old. Her brother (also shown in the photo) is a barber, by profession. He earns a good amount of income to meet family expenses. Over time he has attained a list of regular customers, and he makes enough to contribute to the family income.

He needs to deal with more customers, time after time. For this he requires hair- and skin-care products, along with combs, brushes, and scissors. So Sania has applied for a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR, for her brother. She is confident that his business will move toward a positive direction.

loans.use: to buy tools and products for her brother to use in the barbering business

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children; one of her children is shown in the photo. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a small general store for the past seven years. Over time, he has become popular in their community for providing high quality products and makes enough to meet their family expenses.

Currently, Rabia has received a murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband to buy packs of salt, grains, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at store. She is positive about her husband’s future earnings.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, grains, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at the store.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Lubna is a 32-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Currently she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase another cow to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 23-year-old married woman. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way he has earned a sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Sidra has accessed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. Her husband was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Getazat village of Ararat region. She is a farmer and lives with her husband and 24-year-old son.
 
Anna keeps two greenhouses where she organizes the cultivation of tomato and haricot. After she gathers the harvest, Anna's husband and son help her to sell the harvest in the local market to earn an income for the family's living expenses.
 
The reason Anna has applied for this loan is that the greenhouses she keeps are old and need some improvements. Anna plans to use the loan to pay for renovation of the greenhouses, polyethylene covers for them, and haricot and tomato seeds. The family hopes that lenders will support their loan to be funded. They will be very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of greenhouses, polyethylene covers, and haricot and tomato seeds

loans.name: Bonifred

texts.en:
Bonifred is age 39. She is married with four children, ages between 4 and 12 years, all of them going to school. 

Bonifred has a shop and has been working in a business for nine years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine, who lives in Araqsavan village, is occupied in agriculture. She keeps six greenhouses, and in two of them she cultivates peppers. In the other four are tomatoes. Armine lives with her mother-in-law, her sister-in-law, her husband, and two infant children. As a hardworking family, they are able to get a good harvest during the year and sell it at local markets.

The reason she is applying for this loan is the bad condition of the greenhouses. Armine asks lenders to support her with improving her family's greenhouses, so they will be able to continue their business. Armine, with the loan, plans to purchase polyethylene covers for the greenhouses and organize the renovation of the greenhouses.

The whole family will be very thankful to lenders if they give support to collect the needed money and improve their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene covers and renovations for the greenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concentrated pellets and other feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina  is 33 years old, a married woman. She has six children. 

Sakina  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to fill the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Sakina  closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more beads, thread, and frames

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis sells livestock and has been running this business for 20 years now. He is 64 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with six children. Besides the livestock-selling business as his primary activity, he also sells cereals and green vegetables and that has been profitable.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of cereals and green vegetables to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. In future he hopes to have a prosperous business and live happily with his family.

loans.use: To buy cereals and greens to sell.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 38 years old. He is married to his wife and together they have been blessed with five children, with ages ranging from two to 17 years.

Clement is a poultry farmer and a plumber. He has run both businesses for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Clement has requested a third loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 30,000, which he will use to buy poultry. With the anticipated profits, Clement will be able to repay his loan. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have an improved life and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
The role of transport to rural smallholder farmers in Kenya like Stephen (pictured) is crucial. As in other businesses, transportation is a phase in the production process which is not complete until the commodity is in the hands of the final consumers. 

Stephen, 35, lives with his family on a small piece of land in Kapsowar. The region is popular for growing maize as a staple food. Stephen had been engaged in farming--keeping poultry and dairy cows--for not less than five years, when he saw a big gap and seized the opportunity. The road networks in Kapsowar have been terrible since time immemorial. The road situation has forced farmers to sell their produce within their environs at a low price because of surplus supply. Roads to the farm can hardly be accessed by motor vehicles. 

Stephen purchased an ideal Indian motorcycle with low fuel consumption, low maintenance costs and a great deal of flexibility. With this machine, he was able to transport his milk and eggs to a distant market with fair prices, as well as offer transportation services to pedestrians along the way when he was returning. He saw a bigger potential in helping other farmers transport their produce and sell it at a better market price. Stephen is seeking a loan to purchase more motorcycles. This will enable him to fill the demand for his services as well as offer employment to others in his community. With your loan, Stephen will realize his vision of offering transformational transport solutions that seek to improve agricultural productivity, enhance quality of life for farmers, create a market for agricultural produce, facilitate interaction among geographical and economic regions, and open up new areas for economic focus.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycles for transportation of farm produce to market

loans.name: Emmerance

texts.en: Emmerance is 22 years old. She is not married. She has a shop and has been running the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more lotion, salt and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more lotion, salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is Hawa.  She was married In 2000. Hawa established her local food stuff (groundnut, beans, garrie and rice) business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of herself and her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are of all ages. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice, garrie, beans, and groundnut. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit and capital. In the future, Hawa plans to improve her children's education and enroll them in a better school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for groundnut, garrie, beans and rice

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is 32 years old. She is married with four children between 4 and 12 years old and all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in the business for nine years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more maize flour, salt, biscuits and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, salt, biscuits and soap for sale.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 29-year-old married man and a father of only one child. Yahya has a secondary education, but he couldn't complete his studies. He lives with his family in a very old house that needs to be renovated on the inside. For this reason, Yahya applied for a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to renovate his old house.

Yahya looks forward to making his house safe and comfortable. He hopes to build another floor on the house to make it more spacious.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVD discs and player

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en: This is forty-two-year-old Nanah. She is married and has two children aged twenty-six and twenty-two. She also has two additional dependents, who live with her to help with the house chores. In 2001, Nanah established her hot rub (menthol rub) business. She began her business because she wants to take care of herself and her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all ages. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Nanah requires a loan in order to buy additional hot rub. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit and capital. In the future, Nanah plans to own a shop instead of table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy menthol rub.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Simon, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is 42 years of age, very hardworking, and a go-getter. He is a proud father of three lovely children. He hails from Igoki, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and, to survive, you must have tough skin. Simon has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 20 years. His primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Simon passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Mutune” (meaning brown). Whenever he is milking his cow, he feels proud. 

He is contented with the farming way of life. His biggest challenge in farming is irrigating his farm. He is requesting a loan to buy a generator that he will use to pump water from the river to his farm. Irrigation is used to assist in the growing of agricultural crops, maintenance of landscapes, and re-vegetation of disturbed soils in dry areas and during periods of inadequate rainfall. Through this loan, he will be able to double his crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, he will be able to support his family and keep up with his rising family expenses. Simon patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a generator to be used in irrigation

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is an industrious, 28-year-old smallholder maize farmer from Mutwot, in the North Rift area of Kenya.  Six years ago, he started farming, and around the same time married a lovely and gorgeous dark Kenyan woman named Lydia.  The couple is blessed with 2 children aged 4 and 6.  Julius places his family at the center of his life which gives him the spirit to overcome life's everyday struggles.  His love for his family also fires up his passion for growing his business activities to make his clients and family happy and satisfied. 

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase poultry.  This is a totally new business he is venturing in to, but he is confident about its future since he is counting on the unstinted support of his wife and children.  Julius himself is vested in the maize, timber, and motorcycle business that he has been actively running for over half a decade.  The timber business is a big one for him, coming from a county where timber corporations own hundreds of thousands of acres of trees planted for timber.  The motorcycle also comes in handy when he is transporting farm produce, wood, or even passages across short distances. 

With your loan, the poultry farm will not only provide Julius' family with an additional source of income but also the produce will improve their diet

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Daniel, a very hardworking, energetic and honest man who is 23 years of age. He lives in the rich highlands of Molo with his family. Daniel has been practicing farming for the past five years. Through those years, he has been able to support his family. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and crop farming. 

The Molo area is populated and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Daniel's biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya, and one doesn’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Daniel will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, it being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in his area. 

Daniel has been facing challenges accessing finances, but he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Daniel chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rates on the their loans are low and on a reducing basis. Daniel underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Daniel's income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario  de 24 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 6 y 2 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela por ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa trabajando. Su esposo en chofer de una ruta de buses, solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Rosario es comerciante, tiene un chalet donde vende frutas, verduras y granos básicos, se dedica a este tipo de negocio desde que era muy pequeña y trabajaba con su tía. Su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar céntrico, trabja de 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm, camina 10 minutos para llegar después de hacer los oficios del hogar y pasar dejando a sus hijos en la escuela.

El prestamos será utilizado para comprar manzanas, uvas, peras, tomates, chile verde, cebollas, zanahorias, maíz, frijol, maicillo y demás para tener abastecido el chalet y no perder clientes por no contar con producto que le demanden. Rosario espera ampliar su negocio y tener otro local donde tenga que emplear a otra persona para ser fuente de trabajo, también espera terminar la construcción de su casa lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Rosario is 24 years old. She has a partner and three children, who are seven, six, and two years old. She studied up to third grade of elementary school, and then had to leave school inb order to help her parents with household expenses by working. Her husband is a driver on a bus route, and he and their children are all those who live with her.

Rosario is a shopkeeper, and has a small store where she sells fruit, vegetables, and basic grains. She has done this type of work since she was very small, when she worked with her aunt. Her business is centrally located; she works there every day from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., walking ten minutes to get there after finishing her household chores and dropping her children off at school. 

She will use the loan to buy apples, pears, grapes, tomatoes, green chilis, onions, carrots, maize, beans, sorghum, and other items to stock her store, and make sure she does not lose customers by not having the product they are asking for. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business and open a second store, where she would employ another person and become a source of employment. She also helps to finish the construction of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, grapes, tomatoes, green chilis, onions, carrots, maize, beans, sorghum, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more food materials and items to expand her business.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya, an agronomist from Sevqar village, lives with her parents, brother and sister. Her mother is a schoolteacher, and other family members are occupied in agriculture. 

The farm Sonya's family keeps includes cows, calves, pigs and hens. Near the house where they live, Sonya's family also owns a plot of land where corn and potatoes are cultivated. 

This loan will greatly help Sonya to organize the renovation of the barn's roof and also buy a lot of animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn's roof, and buy fodder for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives with her nice, big family of 8: her parents, her six sisters and one brother. Her family is occupied in agriculture. Her father is specialized in beekeeping and besides their own beehives, he also, for a rent, keeps his co villagers' beehives. 

Astghik, the youngest child in the family, greatly supports her parents to sustain their farming business and earn income for living. Besides farming work, Astghik is also involved in carpet weaving. Her works are very beautiful due to her talent and care.  The loan Astghik is asking for is very important for her family to purchase 13 colonies of bees and to enlarge the beekeeping business. The whole family hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 13 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesus es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sahagun.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar una guadañadora y así mantener libre de malezas su cultivo, de esta forma mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa. 

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores. 

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras.
texts.en:
Jesus is a veteran field worker with enough energy to produce any crop. He is humble and simple and has a great way with people. 

Jesus grows plantains and yucca and works his fields every day so he can sell his crops in the Sahagun market. Thanks to his years of experience and the teaching his father imparted to him as a child, he is fully capable of working and helping the other farmers in the area who need assistance with their crops. 

He is asking for the loan to buy a scythe to keep his fields free of weeds, in this way improving his crops significantly. He has a lot of faith in his business and high hopes for the caring people who support farm workers. Support a humble farmer so that he can develop his land.

loans.use: to buy a scythe.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is an industrious woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has one grown-up child. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods and soft drinks. Aside from this, she engages in fishing. She sells fish to a nearby community. These are her sources of income. She has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for 20 years now. Rosa requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a variety of stock and fishing nets, to refill her store with various items and also improve her husband's daily catch.

Rosa hopes to have a stable income that would help her improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock and fishing nets

loans.name: Fareed  Unnisa

texts.en:
Fareed Unnisa is a 58-year-old married woman. She has three children. One of her sons (shown in the photo) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Fareed Unnisa has applied for a murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for the growth of her son's business. Her son was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase high quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 38-year-old, married mother of two children. She is a caring housewife who puts much effort into supporting her beloved husband.
