He is a retired soldier and a truck driver with a limited monthly salary to take care of their children and provide them with living necessities. Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her children's school tuition fees. Fatima is working hard to open her own grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas de Magdalena
Este dúo está formado por doña Marta Julia, ella tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica a atender su miscelánea de venta de ropa, zapatos , ollas, pantalones para dama caballero y niños así como lencería en general, venta de cosméticos y venta de regalos, ubicado en Magdalena, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ollas de presión, compra de ponchos de lana, compra de pantalones para dama caballero y niños asi como blusas de dama, y necesita comprar media docena de licuadoras para surtir su negocio,  su deseo es seguir surtiendo su tienda y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que deseen, su mayor anhelo es agrandar su local.
texts.en:
Duo Mariposas de Magdalena. This group is made up of two members. Marta Julia is 50 years old. She works in her miscellaneous store. She sells clothes, shoes, pots, pants for women, men, and children, and also lingerie. She also sells cosmetic products, and gift articles.

It is located in Magdalena. She is requesting a loan to buy pressure cookers, wool ponchos, pants for women, men, and children, also blouses, and she has to buy a half dozen of blenders to supply her business. 

Her wish is to keep getting supplies for her store, and offer her clients what they need. She would really like to make her store bigger.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell .

loans.name: Minaia

texts.en:
Minaia is a 36-year-old divorced woman, from Gardabani district. She alone takes care of her daughter and earns a living working as a sales lady at the local general store. Her income consists of 250 GEL monthly and is hardly enough to cover even basic needs. Minaia has a great desire to do her best for the family’s welfare and wants to start her own parallel activity.  Minaia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

Minaia has requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's poor people, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers," because of their low income and they do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Minaia will purchase a stock of clothing and start trading in her community. She will sell clothing at price mark-ups and will be able to tackle the financial difficulties.  Minaia and her daughter rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders’ help.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing to generate additional income.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He is married with 3 children who are between 4 and 11 years old; all of them go to school.

He has a shop and has been running a business for 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy salt, biscuits and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits and soap to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old. She is married with one child who is 4 years old and does not yet go to school.

She has a shop and has been running a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy sugar, biscuits and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy sugar, biscuits and rice to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 24 years old, and married with a 5 year old child.  She has been in the clothing sales business for 3 years.  After obtaining her loan, she would like to buy more clothing for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Elsa has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her business. Elsa wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Jackson, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 33-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner for his family, with a wife and one children, he farms a small plot of land in the green lush hills of Nkubu in the central region of Kenya.  For the past 16 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling.  He is also engaged in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. 

Jackson passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality-breed dairy cow. The chaff cutter will assist Jackson in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed his cows. Also, it will aid the animals' digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food.  Jackson also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality-breed cow that will be producing between 15-25 litres of milk a day.  The selling price for milk is 40 Kenyan shillings per liter and through this loan, he will be making a cool US $11 per day. 

Before Jackson joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Jackson now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”.  

With this loan, Jackson will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows, and through this loan Jackson will achieve this.  An increase in income will allow Jackson to improve his living conditions and secure the future for his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Jackson fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

loans.use: buy a chaff cutter and a dairy cow

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 36-year-old married father of two children. He started two years ago working as a mechanic with a limited salary and tries desperately to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Rabih is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to Rabih for it will help him build a better future for his beloved kids. He hopes to open his own blacksmith shop which will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. 

Rabih and his two daughters are appearing in the photo.

loans.use: pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy poultry
